'''Giannis Sina Ugo Antetokounmpo'''{{efn|{{IPAc-en|'|j|ɑː|n|ɪ|s|_|ˈ|uː|g|oʊ|_|ˌ|ɑː|n|t|ɛ|t|ə|'|k|uː|m|p|oʊ}} {{respell|YAH|niss|_|OO|goh|_|AHN|tet|ə|KOOM|poh}};<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SD4lSIlGZQY |archive-url=https://ghostarchive.org/varchive/youtube/20211028/SD4lSIlGZQY |archive-date=October 28, 2021 |title=Giannis Antetokounmpo explains how to pronounce his last name {{!}} ESPN |date=November 11, 2017 |publisher=[[ESPN]] via [[YouTube]]}}{{cbignore}}</ref> {{langx|el|Γιάννης Σίνα-Ούγκο Αντετοκούνμπο}}, {{IPA|el|ˈʝanis a(n)detoˈkumbo|IPA}}.}} ([[né]] '''Adetokunbo''';{{efn|His official surname ({{lang|el|Αντετοκούνμπο}}) is a [[Hellenization|Greek transcription]] of his parents' [[Yoruba language]] name {{lang|yo|[[Adetokunbo|Adétòkunbọ̀]]}}; [[Greek alphabet#Digraphs and letter combinations|in Greek]], ‹{{lang|el|ντ}}› is used for {{IPAslink|d}}, ‹{{lang|el|ου}}› for {{IPAslink|u}}, and ‹{{lang|el|μπ}}› for {{IPAslink|b}}. This is usually [[ISO 843|transliterated letter-for-letter]] back into the [[Latin alphabet]] as ''Antetokounmpo''.}} born December 6, 1994) is a Greek and Nigerian<!-- See MOS:CONTEXTBIO. Antetokounmpo holds dual Greek and Nigerian citizenship. --> professional [[basketball]] player for the [[Milwaukee Bucks]] of the [[National Basketball Association]] (NBA). His size, speed, strength, and country of origin have earned him the nickname "'''Greek Freak'''". He is widely regarded as one of the greatest [[Power forward (basketball)|power forwards]] of all time as well as one of the greatest players of all time.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://hoopshype.com/lists/20-greatest-power-forwards-ever-the-hoopshype-list/ |title=20 greatest power forwards ever: The HoopsHype list |date=November 21, 2021 |publisher=hoopshype.com |access-date=December 5, 2022 |archive-date=December 5, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20221205215644/https://hoopshype.com/lists/20-greatest-power-forwards-ever-the-hoopshype-list/ |url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://playersbio.com/best-power-forwards/ |title=Ten Best Power Forwards Ever in NBA |date=May 20, 2022 |publisher=playersbio.com |author=Thapa, Aastha |access-date=December 5, 2022 |archive-date=December 5, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20221205215644/https://playersbio.com/best-power-forwards/ |url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.scottfujita.com/best-power-forwards-in-nba/ |title=The Best Power Forwards In NBA History: All-Time Rankings |date=November 10, 2022 |publisher=scottfujita.com |author=Fujita, Scott |access-date=December 5, 2022 |archive-date=December 5, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20221205215643/https://www.scottfujita.com/best-power-forwards-in-nba/ |url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |date=July 31, 2022 |title=The NBA 75th anniversary team ranked |url=https://www.espn.com/nba/story/_/id/33297498/the-nba-75th-anniversary-team-ranked-where-76-basketball-legends-check-our-list/ |access-date=December 24, 2023 |website=Espn |archive-date=December 24, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231224110013/https://www.espn.com/nba/story/_/id/33297498/the-nba-75th-anniversary-team-ranked-where-76-basketball-legends-check-our-list/ |url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |date=January 18, 2022 |title=NBA 75 at no 24 Giannis Antetokounmpo has become one of the games most decorated |url=https://theathletic.com/3073534/2022/01/18/nba-75-at-no-24-giannis-antetokounmpo-has-become-one-of-the-games-most-decorated-players-in-less-than-a-decade// |access-date=December 24, 2023 |website=The Athletic |archive-date=December 9, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231209114723/https://theathletic.com/3073534/2022/01/18/nba-75-at-no-24-giannis-antetokounmpo-has-become-one-of-the-games-most-decorated-players-in-less-than-a-decade/ |url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |last1=Bailey |first1=Andy |title=Ranking the Top 50 NBA Playoff Performers of All Time |url=https://bleacherreport.com/articles/10124068-ranking-the-top-50-nba-playoff-performers-of-all-time |website=[[Bleacher Report]] |access-date=June 22, 2024 |date=June 18, 2024}}</ref>

Born and raised in [[Athens]] to Nigerian parents, Antetokounmpo began playing basketball for the youth teams of [[EFAO Zografou B.C.|Filathlitikos]] in Athens. In 2011, he began playing for the club's senior team before entering the [[2013 NBA draft]], where he was selected 15th overall by the Bucks. In [[2016–17 Milwaukee Bucks season|2016–17]], he led the Bucks in all five major statistical categories and became the first player in NBA history to finish a regular season in the top 20 in all five statistics: total points, rebounds, assists, steals, and blocks.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.nba.com/article/2017/04/12/giannis-antetokounmpo-leads-milwaukee-bucks-five-major-statistical-categories |title=Milwaukee Bucks superstar Giannis Antetokounmpo finishes breakout season in league of his own |work=NBA.com |date=April 12, 2017 |access-date=April 13, 2017 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170414001717/http://www.nba.com/article/2017/04/12/giannis-antetokounmpo-leads-milwaukee-bucks-five-major-statistical-categories |archive-date=April 14, 2017 |url-status=live}}</ref> He received the [[NBA Most Improved Player Award|Most Improved Player]] award in 2017. Antetokounmpo has received eight [[NBA All-Star Game|All-Star]] selections, including being selected as an All-Star captain in 2019, 2020, 2023 and 2024 as he led the [[Eastern Conference (NBA)|Eastern Conference]] in voting in these four years.

One of the most decorated players in NBA history,<ref>{{cite web |url=https://theathletic.com/3073534/2022/01/18/nba-75-at-no-24-giannis-antetokounmpo-has-become-one-of-the-games-most-decorated-players-in-less-than-a-decade/ |title=NBA 75: At No. 24, Giannis Antetokounmpo has become one of the game's most decorated players in less than a decade – The Athletic |publisher=Theathletic.com |date=January 18, 2022 |access-date=February 15, 2022 |archive-date=March 7, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220307052121/https://theathletic.com/3073534/2022/01/18/nba-75-at-no-24-giannis-antetokounmpo-has-become-one-of-the-games-most-decorated-players-in-less-than-a-decade/ |url-status=live}}</ref> Antetokounmpo won consecutive [[NBA Most Valuable Player Award]]s in 2019 and 2020, joining [[Kareem Abdul-Jabbar]] and [[LeBron James]] as the only players in NBA history to win two MVPs before turning 26. Along with his MVP award, he was named the [[NBA Defensive Player of the Year Award|NBA Defensive Player of the Year]] in 2020, becoming only the third player, after [[Michael Jordan]] (1988) and [[Hakeem Olajuwon]] (1994), to win both awards in the same season. In [[2021 NBA Finals|2021]], Antetokounmpo led the Bucks to their first [[List of NBA champions|NBA championship]] since [[1971 NBA Finals|1971]] and was named [[NBA Finals Most Valuable Player Award|Finals MVP]].<ref name="freak">{{cite web |url=https://www.cbssports.com/nba/news/giannis-antetokounmpo-wins-2021-nba-finals-mvp-bucks-star-becomes-youngest-winner-since-kawhi-leonard-in-2014/ |title=Giannis Antetokounmpo wins 2021 NBA Finals MVP |website=CBS Sports |last=Quinn |first=Sam |date=July 21, 2021 |access-date=July 21, 2021 |archive-date=July 23, 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210723031121/https://www.cbssports.com/nba/news/giannis-antetokounmpo-wins-2021-nba-finals-mvp-bucks-star-becomes-youngest-winner-since-kawhi-leonard-in-2014/ |url-status=live}}</ref> The same year, he was honored as one of the league's greatest players of all time by being named to the [[NBA 75th Anniversary Team]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.nba.com/news/nba-75th-anniversary-team-announced |title=NBA 75th Anniversary Team announced |date=October 21, 2021 |website=NBA.com |access-date=November 5, 2021 |archive-date=October 22, 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20211022003548/https://www.nba.com/news/nba-75th-anniversary-team-announced |url-status=live}}</ref> The film ''[[Rise (2022 film)|Rise]]'', based on the life of Antetokounmpo and his family, was released in 2022. In 2024, he led the Bucks to win the [[2024 NBA Cup|2nd edition]] of the [[NBA Cup]], where he  was named [[NBA Cup#MVP|NBA Cup MVP]].

For his sporting achievements in his discipline, on July 10, 2024, the [[Greek Olympic Committee]] designated him as the flag bearer for the [[2024 Summer Olympics|Paris 2024 Olympic Games]], along with the Greek [[Racing|race walker]] [[Antigoni Drisbioti]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.anocolympic.org/noc-highlights/greeces-flagbearers-for-paris-olympics-announced/#:~:text=The%20Plenary%20Session%20of%20the,the%20Paris%202024%20Olympic%20Games. |title=GREECE'S FLAGBEARERS FOR PARIS OLYMPICS ANNOUNCED |publisher=Greek Olympic Committee |language=EN |date=July 11, 2024 |access-date=July 11, 2024}}</ref>

==Early life==
As the son of immigrants from Nigeria,<ref>{{cite news |date=July 1, 2019 |title=Giannis Antetokounmpo: NBA star's rise from 'hustling' on Athens streets to MVP award |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/basketball/48832050 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190709065024/https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/basketball/48832050 |archive-date=July 9, 2019 |access-date=July 9, 2019 |work=BBC Sport}}</ref><ref name="Hein">{{cite web |last=Hein |first=David |date=March 16, 2013 |title=Adetokoubo's whirlwind saga just starting |url=http://www.fiba.com/pages/eng/fc/news/colu/p/newsid/55082/arti.html |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150217234719/http://www.fiba.com/pages/eng/fc/news/colu/p/newsid/55082/arti.html |archive-date=February 17, 2015 |access-date=January 23, 2015 |work=FIBA.com}}</ref><ref name="neoskosmos">{{cite web |last=Hein |first=David |date=July 13, 2013 |title=Greek-Nigerian prodigy makes NBA dream come true |url=http://neoskosmos.com/news/en/Greek-Nigerian-prodigy-makes-NBA-dream-come-true |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160201171740/http://neoskosmos.com/news/en/Greek-Nigerian-prodigy-makes-NBA-dream-come-true |archive-date=February 1, 2016 |access-date=January 24, 2015 |work=FIBA.com}}</ref> Giannis Sina Ugo Adetokunbo<ref name="Spears2019" /><ref>{{cite web |title=Giannis Sina Ougko ANTETOKOUNMPO |work=FIBA.basketball |url=http://www.fiba.basketball/oqt/italy/2016/player/Giannis-Sina-Ougko-Antetokounmpo |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190428173315/http://www.fiba.basketball/oqt/italy/2016/player/Giannis-Sina-Ougko-Antetokounmpo |archive-date=April 28, 2019}}</ref> was born in [[Athens]], Greece, on December 6, 1994.<ref name="fiba">{{cite web |title=Giannis Antetokounmpo |url=http://www.fibaeurope.com/compID_UIfgjyQcGqk-fPlnl66Tj0.season_2013.roundID_9352.teamID_291.playerID_99285.html |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150706205141/http://www.fibaeurope.com/compID_UIfgjyQcGqk-fPlnl66Tj0.season_2013.roundID_9352.teamID_291.playerID_99285.html |archive-date=July 6, 2015 |access-date=April 4, 2016 |work=FIBAEurope.com}}</ref> His father was a [[soccer]] player and his mother was a [[high jumper]] in Nigeria. Three years earlier, they had moved from [[Lagos]], leaving their firstborn son, Francis, under the care of his grandparents.<ref name=npr>{{cite web |url=https://www.npr.org/2013/09/26/226268651/nbas-g-bo-wants-to-bring-hope-to-greece-and-to-milwaukee |title=NBA Rookie Wants To Bring Hope To Greece, And To Milwaukee |work=NPR.com |date=September 26, 2013 |access-date=April 9, 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160423082144/http://www.npr.org/2013/09/26/226268651/nbas-g-bo-wants-to-bring-hope-to-greece-and-to-milwaukee |archive-date=April 23, 2016 |url-status=live}}</ref> Adetokunbo grew up in the Athens neighborhood of [[Sepolia]]<ref name="neoskosmos"/> in a primarily [[Culture of Nigeria|Nigerian household]].<ref name=spears_03052019/> His parents, as immigrants without work permits,<ref>{{cite web |first=Gerald |last=Flores |title=Giannis Antetokounmpo Wanted to Wear Sweats to the NBA Draft |date=October 4, 2022 |work=Esquire |url=https://www.esquire.com/style/mens-fashion/a41514125/giannis-antetokounmpo-nba-style/ |access-date=February 13, 2023 |archive-date=February 13, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230213111144/https://www.esquire.com/style/mens-fashion/a41514125/giannis-antetokounmpo-nba-style/ |url-status=live}}</ref> could not easily find work, so Giannis and his older brother [[Thanasis Antetokounmpo|Thanasis]] helped by [[Hawker (trade)|hawking]] watches, handbags, and sunglasses in the streets.<ref>{{cite news |last=Maguire |first=Ken |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2013/06/26/sports/basketball/in-an-athens-suburb-nba-scouts-unearth-a-rare-find.html |title=A Hunger for a Better Life May Lead to the N.B.A. |work=[[The New York Times]] |date=June 26, 2013 |access-date=December 31, 2015 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160204041851/http://www.nytimes.com/2013/06/26/sports/basketball/in-an-athens-suburb-nba-scouts-unearth-a-rare-find.html |archive-date=February 4, 2016 |url-status=live}}</ref> In 2007, Adetokunbo started playing basketball.<ref name="Triantafyllos"/>

Although Adetokunbo and three of his four brothers were born in Greece, they did not automatically receive [[Greek nationality law|Greek citizenship]] as Greek nationality law follows ''[[jus sanguinis]]''.<ref name="Hein"/> Growing up, he sometimes felt like an outsider to both the Greek and Nigerian communities in Athens due to his parents' heritage and different skin color in the former, and due to his lack of understanding of the [[Yoruba language|Yoruba]] or [[Igbo language|Igbo]] languages in the latter.<ref name="askounis_09222022">{{cite web |last=Askounis |first=Johnny |date=September 22, 2022 |title=Giannis Antetokounmpo 'feels both Greek and Nigerian' |url=https://www.eurohoops.net/en/nba-news/1394148/giannis-antetokounmpo-talks-short-film-naija-odyssey-nigeria-greece/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230213101812/https://www.eurohoops.net/en/nba-news/1394148/giannis-antetokounmpo-talks-short-film-naija-odyssey-nigeria-greece/ |archive-date=February 13, 2023 |access-date=February 13, 2023 |work=Eurohoops.net}}</ref> For the first 18 years of his life, Adetokunbo could not travel outside the country and was effectively [[Statelessness|stateless]], having no papers from Greece or Nigeria.<ref name=Triantafyllos>{{cite web |last=Triantafyllos |first=Stefanos |url=http://www.nba.com/global/antetokounmpo_center_of_heated_debate_greece_2013_07_08.html |title=Heated Debate Around Antetokounmpo's Home Reflects Rift in Birthplace of Democracy |work=NBA.com |date=July 8, 2013 |access-date=April 4, 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160610151612/http://www.nba.com/global/antetokounmpo_center_of_heated_debate_greece_2013_07_08.html |archive-date=June 10, 2016 |url-status=dead}}</ref> He was eventually issued Greek citizenship on May 9, 2013,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.sport24.gr/Basket/ellhnes_polites_oi_aderfoi_antetokoumpo.2244998.html |title=Έλληνες πολίτες οι αδερφοί Αντετοκούμπο |work=Sport24.gr |date=May 9, 2013 |access-date=December 31, 2015 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141006102841/http://www.sport24.gr/Basket/ellhnes_polites_oi_aderfoi_antetokoumpo.2244998.html |archive-date=October 6, 2014 |url-status=live}}</ref> less than two months before the [[2013 NBA draft|NBA draft]].<ref name="Triantafyllos" />

After gaining Greek citizenship, his official surname became {{lang|el|Αντετοκούνμπο}}, the [[Romanization of Greek|Greek transcription]] of ''Adetokunbo'', which was then [[ISO 843|transliterated]] letter-for-letter and officially spelled on his Greek passport as ''Antetokounmpo''.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://qz.com/africa/1569408/nbas-giannis-antetokounmpo-mvp-favorite-isnt-big-in-nigeria/#:~:text=After%20gaining%20Greek%20citizenship%20in,right%20away%2C%E2%80%9D%20Adefeso%20says. |date=March 11, 2019 |via=Quartz Africa |access-date=March 11, 2019 |title=The best player in the NBA is 'Nigerian' but most Nigerians have no idea who he is |archive-date=April 6, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220406115030/https://qz.com/africa/1569408/nbas-giannis-antetokounmpo-mvp-favorite-isnt-big-in-nigeria/#:~:text=After%20gaining%20Greek%20citizenship%20in,right%20away%2C%E2%80%9D%20Adefeso%20says. |url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite tweet |user=DimitropulosOCT |number=332489901717196801 |date=May 9, 2013 |title=Giannis Antetokounmpo received today his Greek citizenship. As of today, this shall be the official name/surname as it appears in ID/Passport}}</ref> ''Giannis'' is a [[Modern Greek]] variant of ''Ioannes'' (John).<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.behindthename.com/name/giannis |title="Giannis", Behind the Name |access-date=July 22, 2021 |archive-date=January 20, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220120195540/https://www.behindthename.com/name/giannis |url-status=live}}</ref> Because many NBA fans could not pronounce his surname, he quickly became known as the "Greek Freak".<ref>{{cite web |date=June 24, 2019 |title=Nigerian athletes on what a 'Greek Freak' MVP means |url=https://andscape.com/features/nigerian-athletes-on-what-giannis-antetokounmpo-greek-freak-mvp-would-mean/ |access-date=July 21, 2021 |website=[[Andscape]] |language=en-US |archive-date=August 7, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220807184030/https://andscape.com/features/nigerian-athletes-on-what-giannis-antetokounmpo-greek-freak-mvp-would-mean/ |url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |last=Wojnarowski |first=Adrian |url=https://sports.yahoo.com/news/from-selling-sunglasses-on-street-to-nba-player-on-the-rise--greek-freak-living-the-american-dream-214309752.html |title=From street vendor to surging NBA player, Greek Freak living the American dream |work=Yahoo.com |date=March 18, 2014 |access-date=April 4, 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160415011041/http://sports.yahoo.com/news/from-selling-sunglasses-on-street-to-nba-player-on-the-rise--greek-freak-living-the-american-dream-214309752.html |archive-date=April 15, 2016 |url-status=live}}</ref> Antetokounmpo also holds Nigerian citizenship,<ref name="Spears2019" /> having received his Nigerian passport in 2015,<ref name=spears_03052019>{{cite news |last1=Spears |first1=Marc J. |title='The Greek Freak' wants to go back to his Nigerian roots |url=https://andscape.com/features/bucks-giannis-antetokounmpo-greek-freak-wants-to-go-back-to-his-nigerian-roots/ |access-date=August 17, 2021 |work=[[Andscape]] |date=March 5, 2019 |archive-date=March 8, 2019 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190308205554/https://theundefeated.com/features/bucks-giannis-antetokounmpo-greek-freak-wants-to-go-back-to-his-nigerian-roots/ |url-status=live}}</ref> and as such possesses [[dual citizenship]].<ref>{{cite web |title=Five things you didn't know about NBA MVP Giannis Antetokounmpo |url=https://olympics.com/en/featured-news/five-things-about-nba-mvp-giannis-antetokounmpo |access-date=August 17, 2021 |website=Olympics.com |archive-date=December 1, 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20211201103518/https://olympics.com/en/featured-news/five-things-about-nba-mvp-giannis-antetokounmpo |url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |title=Giannis Antetokounmpo |url=https://www.nba.com/bucks/roster/giannis-antetokounmpo |access-date=August 17, 2021 |website=NBA.com |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20211201092054/https://www.nba.com/bucks/roster/giannis-antetokounmpo |archive-date=December 1, 2021}}</ref> He has stated that he feels both Greek and Nigerian<ref name=askounis_09222022/> and that he embraces both his Greek, as well as his African/Nigerian identity.<ref name=spears_03052019/>

==Professional career==
===Filathlitikos (2011–2013)===
Antetokounmpo played with the senior men's team of [[EFAO Zografou B.C.|Filathlitikos]] in the [[semi-professional|semi-pro]] [[Greek B Basket League]] (Third Division) during the 2011–12 season.<ref name=roster1112>{{cite web |url=https://basketball.eurobasket.com/teamDetails.asp?id=7423&SectionName=Greece&TeamName=Filathlitikos-AO&Page=1&Year=2011-2012 |title=Filathlitikos AO basketball, News, Roster, Rumors, Stats, Awards, Transactions, Details - eurobasket |website=www.eurobasket.com |access-date=July 9, 2019 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190129235936/https://basketball.eurobasket.com/teamDetails.asp?id=7423&SectionName=Greece&TeamName=Filathlitikos-AO&Page=1&Year=2011-2012 |archive-date=January 29, 2019 |url-status=live}}</ref>

In December 2012, a few days after turning 18, Antetokounmpo signed a four-year deal with Spanish club [[Basket Zaragoza 2002|CAI Zaragoza]],<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.acb.com/redaccion.php?id=90030 |title=Basket CAI Zaragoza se hace con los derechos de Giannis Adetocunbo |work=ACB.com |date=December 17, 2012 |access-date=April 4, 2016 |language=es |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160303194616/http://www.acb.com/redaccion.php?id=90030 |archive-date=March 3, 2016 |url-status=live}}</ref> reportedly including NBA buyouts after each season. Several other major European clubs had been interested in adding him, including [[FC Barcelona Basquet|Barcelona]] and [[Anadolu Efes S.K.|Anadolu Efes]].<ref name="Hein" />

During the 2012–13 Greek A2 League season, Antetokounmpo shot 46.4% from the field (62.1% on two-point field goals), 31.3% from three-point range, and 72.0% from the free throw line, while averaging 22.5 minutes per game. Over 26 games, he averaged 9.5 points, 5.0 rebounds, 1.4 assists, and 1.0 blocks per game.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.fiba.com/pages/eng/fc/gamecent/p/leagueid/GRE2/ot//pid/6059561/season/2013/tid/6001266/playerview.html |title=Giannis Antetokoubo profile |work=FIBA.com |access-date=December 31, 2015 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160310202758/http://www.fiba.com/pages/eng/fc/gamecent/p/leagueid/GRE2/ot//pid/6059561/season/2013/tid/6001266/playerview.html |archive-date=March 10, 2016 |url-status=dead}}</ref> He was also selected by the coaches as a special participant in the 2013 [[HEBA Greek All Star Game|Greek League All-Star Game]]. Even though he was not selected as an all-star, the coaches let him play in the game as a treat for the fans, since he was in attendance at the game.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.sport24.gr/Basket/ElladaBasket/Esake/ola_ta_asteria_sto_all_star_game.2155887.html |title=Όλα τα αστέρια στο All Star Game |work=Sports24.gr |date=March 6, 2013 |access-date=December 31, 2015 |language=el |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141006122324/http://www.sport24.gr/Basket/ElladaBasket/Esake/ola_ta_asteria_sto_all_star_game.2155887.html |archive-date=October 6, 2014 |url-status=live}}</ref> However, he did not get officially counted as an all-star selection, since only players that play in Greece's first division are even eligible to actually be voted to play in the game, and Antetokounmpo was playing in Greece's second division at the time.

=== Milwaukee Bucks (2013–present) ===

====Early years in Milwaukee (2013–2016)====
[[File:Giannis Antetokounmpo.jpg|thumb|Antetokounmpo with the Bucks in November 2014]]
On April 28, 2013, Antetokounmpo officially made himself eligible for the [[2013 NBA draft]].<ref>{{cite tweet |user=DraftExpress |number=328537132597661696 |date=April 28, 2013 |title=Giannis Adetokunbo (@GAdetokunbo) has officially made himself eligible for the 2013 NBA Draft, his agent @DimitropulosFCM tells us.}}</ref> He fulfilled his draft projections as a first-round pick by being selected 15th overall by the [[Milwaukee Bucks]]. On July 30, 2013, he signed his rookie scale contract with the Bucks.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.nba.com/bucks/release/bucks-sign-first-round-pick-giannis-antetokounmpo |title=Bucks Sign First Round Pick Giannis Antetokounmpo |work=NBA.com |date=July 30, 2013 |access-date=April 4, 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160304105209/http://www.nba.com/bucks/release/bucks-sign-first-round-pick-giannis-antetokounmpo |archive-date=March 4, 2016 |url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.nba.com/2013/news/07/30/bucks-sign-neal-antetokounmpo.ap/ |title=Bucks sign Neal, Antetokounmpo |work=NBA.com |date=July 30, 2013 |access-date=February 8, 2015 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141208041823/http://www.nba.com/2013/news/07/30/bucks-sign-neal-antetokounmpo.ap/ |archive-date=December 8, 2014 |url-status=dead}}</ref>

Antetokounmpo made his NBA debut on October 13, 2013, at the age of {{age in years and days|1994|12|6|2013|10|13}}, as one of the [[List of youngest National Basketball Association players|youngest NBA players ever]]. He averaged 6.8 points, 4.4 rebounds, 1.9 assists, 0.8 steals, and 0.8 blocks in 77 appearances during his rookie season. He scored in double figures 23 times and grabbed at least 10 rebounds twice, with both efforts resulting in double-doubles. He finished the season with 61 total blocks, which led all NBA rookies, and was the seventh-most by a Bucks rookie in franchise history. He was selected to participate in the Rising Stars Challenge at NBA All-Star Weekend in New Orleans, where he tallied nine points, two rebounds, and two assists in 17 minutes. At the season's end, he was named to the 2013–14 [[NBA All-Rookie Team|NBA All-Rookie second team]].<ref>{{cite web |last=Gruman |first=Andrew |url=http://www.foxsports.com/wisconsin/story/bucks-antetokounmpo-named-to-nba-s-all-rookie-second-team-052214 |title=Bucks' Antetokounmpo named to NBA's All-Rookie second team |work=FoxSports.com |date=May 22, 2014 |access-date=December 31, 2015 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150705091411/http://www.foxsports.com/wisconsin/story/bucks-antetokounmpo-named-to-nba-s-all-rookie-second-team-052214 |archive-date=July 5, 2015 |url-status=live}}</ref>

Antetokounmpo's second season with the Bucks saw both individual and team development. On February 6, 2015, he recorded a then career-high 27 points and 15 rebounds in a loss to the [[Houston Rockets]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.nba.com/games/20150206/MILHOU/gameinfo.html |title=Houston Rockets hit 15 3-pointers to beat Bucks 117-111 |work=NBA.com |date=February 6, 2015 |access-date=February 8, 2015 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171107040513/http://www.nba.com/games/20150206/MILHOU/gameinfo.html |archive-date=November 7, 2017 |url-status=dead}}</ref> Three days later, he was named the Eastern Conference Player of the Week for games played February 2–8, earning Player of the Week honors for the first time in his career.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.nba.com/bucks/release/giannis-named-eastern-conference-player-week-games-played-feb.-2-8 |title=Giannis Named Eastern Conference Player of the Week for Games Played Feb. 2-8 |work=NBA.com |date=February 9, 2015 |access-date=February 10, 2015 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150211094842/http://www.nba.com/bucks/release/giannis-named-eastern-conference-player-week-games-played-feb.-2-8 |archive-date=February 11, 2015 |url-status=live}}</ref> He later competed in the 2015 [[NBA Slam Dunk Contest]] at NBA All-Star Weekend in New York. On March 9, he scored a then career-high 29 points on 11-of-16 shooting in a loss to the [[New Orleans Pelicans]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.nba.com/games/20150309/NOPMIL/gameinfo.html |title=Davis pours in 43, Pelicans beat Bucks 114-103 |work=NBA.com |date=March 9, 2015 |access-date=March 9, 2015 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171111033006/http://www.nba.com/games/20150309/NOPMIL/gameinfo.html |archive-date=November 11, 2017 |url-status=dead}}</ref>

In the [[2015–16 NBA season|2015–16 season]], Antetokounmpo developed further individually, upping his scoring average to almost 17 points per game. On November 19, he scored a then career-high 33 points in a loss to the [[Cleveland Cavaliers]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.nba.com/games/20151119/MILCLE/gameinfo.html |title=James, Love lead Cavaliers past Bucks, 115-100 |work=NBA.com |date=November 19, 2015 |access-date=December 31, 2015 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170508000442/http://www.nba.com/games/20151119/MILCLE/gameinfo.html |archive-date=May 8, 2017 |url-status=dead}}</ref> On December 12, he recorded a near [[triple-double]] with 11 points, 12 rebounds, and 8 assists, helping the Bucks snap the [[2015–16 Golden State Warriors season|Golden State Warriors]]' 24-game unbeaten start to the season with a 108–95 win.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.nba.com/games/20151212/GSWMIL/gameinfo.html |title=It's over: Bucks hand Warriors 1st loss, win 108-95 |work=NBA.com |date=December 12, 2015 |access-date=December 31, 2015 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20151212000353/http://www.nba.com/games/20151212/GSWMIL/gameinfo.html |archive-date=December 12, 2015 |url-status=dead}}</ref> On February 22, 2016, Antetokounmpo recorded his first career triple-double with 27 points, 12 rebounds, and 10 assists in a 108–101 win over the [[Los Angeles Lakers]]. At 21 years old, he became the youngest Buck to record a triple-double.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.nba.com/games/20160222/LALMIL/gameinfo.html |title=Bucks beat Lakers 108-101 in Kobe's final game in Milwaukee |work=NBA.com |date=February 22, 2016 |access-date=February 22, 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190626180522/https://www.nba.com/games/20160222/LALMIL/gameinfo.html |archive-date=June 26, 2019 |url-status=dead}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |last=Devine |first=Dan |url=https://sports.yahoo.com/blogs/nba-ball-dont-lie/giannis-explodes-for-first-career-triple-double--bucks-beat-lakers-055217966.html |title=Giannis explodes for first career triple-double, Bucks beat Lakers |work=Yahoo.com |date=February 22, 2016 |access-date=February 23, 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160225143156/http://sports.yahoo.com/blogs/nba-ball-dont-lie/giannis-explodes-for-first-career-triple-double--bucks-beat-lakers-055217966.html |archive-date=February 25, 2016 |url-status=live}}</ref>

====First All-Star years (2016–2018)====
[[File:Giannis Antetokoummpo (31669417562).jpg|thumb|Antetokounmpo with the Bucks in December 2016]]
On September 19, 2016, Antetokounmpo agreed to a four-year, $100 million contract extension with the Bucks.<ref>{{cite web |last=Wojnarowski |first=Adrian |url=https://sports.yahoo.com/news/sources-giannis-antetokounmpo-agrees-to-100m-extension-175728368.html |title=Sources: Giannis Antetokounmpo agrees to M extension |work=Yahoo.com |date=September 19, 2016 |access-date=September 19, 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160920132312/http://sports.yahoo.com/news/sources-giannis-antetokounmpo-agrees-to-100m-extension-175728368.html |archive-date=September 20, 2016 |url-status=live}}</ref> Antetokounmpo's fourth year with the Bucks would be his breakout season, as he further increased his statistical output and ascended to stardom. On December 23, he had a then career-high 39 points, eight rebounds, and six assists in a 123–96 win over the [[Washington Wizards]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.espn.com/nba/recap?gameId=400899889 |title=Antetokounmpo scores 39, Bucks beat Wizards 123-96 |work=ESPN.com |date=December 23, 2016 |access-date=December 24, 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161224103500/http://www.espn.com/nba/recap?gameId=400899889 |archive-date=December 24, 2016 |url-status=live}}</ref> A couple of weeks later, Antetokounmpo recorded 27 points and 13 rebounds and made his first game-winning buzzer-beater, a 15-foot turnaround jumper which gave the Bucks a 105–104 victory over the [[New York Knicks]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.espn.com/nba/recap?gameId=400899952 |title=Antetokounmpo's jumper at buzzer gives Bucks win over Knicks |work=ESPN.com |date=January 4, 2017 |access-date=January 6, 2017 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170105221536/http://www.espn.com/nba/recap?gameId=400899952 |archive-date=January 5, 2017 |url-status=live}}</ref> With 25 points against the Knicks on January 6, Antetokounmpo had at least 20 points in his 14th consecutive game, matching the longest streak by a Bucks player since [[Michael Redd]] in 2006.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.espn.com/nba/recap?gameId=400899969 |title=Knicks rally from 18 down, beat Bucks 116-111 to snap skid |work=ESPN.com |date=January 6, 2017 |access-date=January 7, 2017 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170107091808/http://www.espn.com/nba/recap?gameId=400899969 |archive-date=January 7, 2017 |url-status=live}}</ref> On January 19, Antetokounmpo was named a starter on the Eastern Conference All-Star team for the [[2017 NBA All-Star Game]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.nba.com/article/2017/01/19/familiar-names-and-some-new-ones-highlight-all-star-starters |title=Curry, Durant and four first-time starters highlight starting lineups for NBA All-Star 2017 |work=NBA.com |date=January 19, 2017 |access-date=January 23, 2017 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170120014006/http://www.nba.com/article/2017/01/19/familiar-names-and-some-new-ones-highlight-all-star-starters |archive-date=January 20, 2017 |url-status=live}}</ref> At 22 years and 74 days old, he became the youngest player in franchise history to start in an All-Star Game. He also became the first Greek NBA All-Star.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.ekathimerini.com/215450/article/ekathimerini/sports/greek-freak-giannis-antetokounmpo-voted-nba-all-star-game-starter |title='Greek Freak' Giannis Antetokounmpo voted NBA All-Star Game starter |work=ekathimerini.com |date=January 20, 2017 |access-date=January 23, 2017 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170202040729/http://www.ekathimerini.com/215450/article/ekathimerini/sports/greek-freak-giannis-antetokounmpo-voted-nba-all-star-game-starter |archive-date=February 2, 2017 |url-status=live}}</ref> In the game, he led the East with 30 points in a 192–182 loss to the West.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.espn.com/nba/boxscore?gameId=400935635 |title=East vs West |work=ESPN.com |date=February 19, 2017 |access-date=December 4, 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20181204195109/http://www.espn.com/nba/boxscore?gameId=400935635 |archive-date=December 4, 2018 |url-status=live}}</ref> On April 3, 2017, he was named Eastern Conference Player of the Month for games played in March. The award was the first of Antetokounmpo's career and the first for a Buck since Michael Redd won the award in January 2004.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.nba.com/bucks/release/giannis-antetokounmpo-named-kia-nba-eastern-conference-player-month/ |title=GIANNIS ANTETOKOUNMPO NAMED KIA NBA EASTERN CONFERENCE PLAYER OF THE MONTH |work=NBA.com |date=April 3, 2017 |access-date=April 4, 2017 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170405081429/http://www.nba.com/bucks/release/giannis-antetokounmpo-named-kia-nba-eastern-conference-player-month/ |archive-date=April 5, 2017 |url-status=live}}</ref> Antetokounmpo helped the Bucks finish an Eastern Conference-best 14–4 in March, the franchise's first calendar month with at least 14 victories since going 16–2 in February 1971. Antetokounmpo led the Bucks in every one of the five major statistical categories (points, rebounds, assists, steals, and blocks) in the 2016–17 regular season, becoming only the fifth NBA player to do so after [[Dave Cowens]], [[Scottie Pippen]], [[Kevin Garnett]], and [[LeBron James]]; [[Nikola Jokić]] has since matched it.<ref>{{cite web |last=Manrique |first=Bruno |url=http://clutchpoints.com/giannis-antetokounmpo-becomes-5h-player-nba-history-lead-team-5-major-stat-categories/ |title=Giannis Antetokounmpo becomes 5th player in NBA history to lead team in all 5 major stat categories |work=ClutchPoints.com |date=April 9, 2017 |access-date=April 12, 2017 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170412231043/http://clutchpoints.com/giannis-antetokounmpo-becomes-5h-player-nba-history-lead-team-5-major-stat-categories/ |archive-date=April 12, 2017 |url-status=live}}</ref> He also became the first player in NBA history to finish in the top 20 in the league in each of the five major categories in a regular season. As a result of his efforts, Antetokounmpo was named to the [[All-NBA Second Team]], earning his first All-NBA honor.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.nba.com/article/2017/05/18/all-nba-teams-2017-release |title=Russell Westbrook, James Harden, LeBron James lead 2016-17 All-NBA first team |work=NBA.com |date=May 18, 2017 |access-date=June 16, 2017 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170613180324/http://www.nba.com/article/2017/05/18/all-nba-teams-2017-release |archive-date=June 13, 2017 |url-status=live}}</ref> He was also named the recipient of the [[NBA Most Improved Player Award]] for the 2016–17 season, becoming the first player in Bucks history to be named Most Improved Player.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.nba.com/bucks/release/giannis-antetokounmpo-named-nbas-most-improved-player |title=GIANNIS ANTETOKOUNMPO NAMED NBA'S MOST IMPROVED PLAYER |work=NBA.com |date=June 26, 2017 |access-date=June 27, 2017 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170629153138/http://www.nba.com/bucks/release/giannis-antetokounmpo-named-nbas-most-improved-player |archive-date=June 29, 2017 |url-status=live}}</ref>

On April 15, 2017, Antetokounmpo scored a then playoff career-high 28 points in a 97–83 win over the third-seed [[2016–17 Toronto Raptors season|Toronto Raptors]] in Game 1 of their first-round playoff series.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.espn.com/nba/recap?gameId=400950316 |title=Antetokounmpo scores 28 points, Bucks beat Raptors 97-83 |work=ESPN.com |date=April 15, 2017 |access-date=April 15, 2017 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170416125804/http://www.espn.com/nba/recap?gameId=400950316 |archive-date=April 16, 2017 |url-status=live}}</ref> In Game 5 of the series on April 24, Antetokounmpo set a new playoff career-high with 30 points, but could not lead the Bucks to a win as they lost 118–93 to go down 3–2 in the series.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.espn.com/nba/recap?gameId=400950415 |title=Powell scores 25 as Raptors beat Bucks 118-93 in Game 5 |work=ESPN.com |date=April 24, 2017 |access-date=April 25, 2017 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170426021210/http://www.espn.com/nba/recap?gameId=400950415 |archive-date=April 26, 2017 |url-status=live}}</ref> The Bucks went on to lose Game 6 three days later despite a 34-point effort from Antetokounmpo, ending their season.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.espn.com/nba/recap?gameId=400950416 |title=Whew! Raptors blow 25-point lead, but beat Bucks 92-89 |work=ESPN.com |date=April 27, 2017 |access-date=April 27, 2017 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170429000639/http://www.espn.com/nba/recap?gameId=400950416 |archive-date=April 29, 2017 |url-status=live}}</ref>

[[File:Giannis Antetokounmpo (39004611954).jpg|thumb|Antetokounmpo dunking against the Washington Wizards in 2018]]
Antetokounmpo began the [[2017–18 NBA season|2017–18 season]] on a tear, scoring 175 points over the first five games of the season, including a then career-high 44 points in a 113–110 win over the [[Portland Trail Blazers]].<ref name=careerhigh>{{cite web |url=https://www.espn.com/nba/recap?gameId=400974785 |title=Antetokounmpo scores career-high 44, Bucks edge Blazers |work=ESPN.com |date=October 21, 2017 |access-date=October 21, 2017 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171022143505/http://www.espn.com/nba/recap?gameId=400974785 |archive-date=October 22, 2017 |url-status=live}}</ref> He averaged almost 27 points during the season, earning his second straight All-Star nomination and All-NBA selection,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.nba.com/bucks/release/giannis-antetokounmpo-named-starter-2018-all-star-game |title=GIANNIS ANTETOKOUNMPO NAMED A STARTER FOR THE 2018 ALL-STAR GAME |work=NBA.com |date=January 18, 2018 |access-date=January 18, 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180119121201/http://www.nba.com/bucks/release/giannis-antetokounmpo-named-starter-2018-all-star-game |archive-date=January 19, 2018 |url-status=live}}</ref> and broke [[Kareem Abdul-Jabbar|Kareem Abdul Jabbar's]] franchise record for triple-doubles.

In Game 1 of the Bucks' first-round playoff series against the [[2017–18 Boston Celtics season|Boston Celtics]], Antetokounmpo recorded 35 points, 13 rebounds and seven assists in a 113–107 overtime loss.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.espn.com/nba/recap?gameId=401029429 |title=Celtics survive wild finish, hold off Bucks 113-107 in OT |work=ESPN.com |date=April 15, 2018 |access-date=April 15, 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180416134803/http://www.espn.com/nba/recap?gameId=401029429 |archive-date=April 16, 2018 |url-status=live}}</ref> Antetokounmpo's game-winning tip-in in Game 4 equalized the series at two games a piece. However, the Celtics would go on to eliminate the Bucks in seven games, in spite of Antetokounmpo's 22 points and nine rebounds in Game 7.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.espn.com/nba/recap?gameId=401029437 |title=Celtics beat Bucks 112-96 in Game 7, advance to play 76ers |work=ESPN.com |date=April 28, 2018 |access-date=April 28, 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180429110352/http://www.espn.com/nba/recap?gameId=401029437 |archive-date=April 29, 2018 |url-status=live}}</ref>

====Back-to-back MVP and DPOY award (2018–2020)====
Starting from the [[2018–19 NBA season|2018–19 season]], Antetokounmpo and the Bucks achieved a period of sustained team success. Under new coach [[Mike Budenholzer]], the Bucks began the season with seven consecutive victories and went 25–10 before the New Year.<ref>{{cite web |title=Mike Budenholzer Named Head Coach Of The Milwaukee Bucks |url=http://www.nba.com/bucks/news/mike-budenholzer-named-head-coach-milwaukee-bucks |website=NBA.com |access-date=May 17, 2018 |date=May 17, 2018 |archive-date=November 9, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201109032625/http://www.nba.com/bucks/news/mike-budenholzer-named-head-coach-milwaukee-bucks |url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |last=Hardacre |first=Jesse |date=October 31, 2018 |title=At 7–0, the Bucks are Off to a Historic Start |url=https://shepherdexpress.com/sports/bucks/at-7-0-the-bucks-are-off-to-a-historic-start/ |access-date=December 8, 2020 |website=shepherdexpress.com |archive-date=June 19, 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210619074034/https://shepherdexpress.com/sports/bucks/at-7-0-the-bucks-are-off-to-a-historic-start/ |url-status=live}}</ref>

Antetokounmpo was critical to this early success, earning the Eastern Conference Player of the Month awards for October, November, December and February.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.nba.com/bucks/news/giannis-antetokounmpo-named-eastern-conference-player-month |title=Giannis Antetokounmpo Named Eastern Conference Player of the Month |date=December 3, 2018 |work=NBA.com |access-date=December 4, 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20181204054110/https://www.nba.com/bucks/news/giannis-antetokounmpo-named-eastern-conference-player-month |archive-date=December 4, 2018 |url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.nba.com/bucks/news/giannis-antetokounmpo-wins-second-straight-kia-nba-eastern-conference-player-month-award |title=Giannis Antetokounmpo Wins Second Straight KIA NBA Eastern Conference Player of the Month Award |work=NBA.com |date=January 3, 2019 |access-date=February 5, 2019 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190104073513/https://www.nba.com/bucks/news/giannis-antetokounmpo-wins-second-straight-kia-nba-eastern-conference-player-month-award |archive-date=January 4, 2019 |url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.nba.com/bucks/news/giannis-antetokounmpo-named-kia-nba-eastern-conference-player-month |title=Giannis Antetokounmpo Named Kia NBA Eastern Conference Player of the Month |work=NBA.com |date=March 1, 2019 |access-date=March 2, 2019 |url-status=live}}</ref> On March 17, Antetokounmpo scored a then career-high 52 points to go with 16 rebounds in a 130–125 loss to the 76ers.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.espn.com/nba/recap?gameId=401071717 |title=Giannis pours in career-high 52 in loss to Sixers |work=ESPN.com |date=March 17, 2019 |access-date=March 18, 2019 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190329150418/http://www.espn.com/nba/recap?gameId=401071717 |archive-date=March 29, 2019 |url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.cbssports.com/fantasy/basketball/news/bucks-giannis-antetokounmpo-career-high-52-points-in-loss/ |title=Bucks' Giannis Antetokounmpo: Career-high 52 points in loss |work=cbssports.com this loss in an April 4 victory where he recorded 45 points and 13 rebounds in a 128–122 win over the 76ers, helping the Bucks clinch the No. 1 seed in the Eastern Conference.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.espn.com/nba/recap?gameId=401071850 |title=Bucks clinch top seed in the East with win over 76ers |work=ESPN.com |date=April 4, 2019 |access-date=April 5, 2019 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190406131002/http://www.espn.com/nba/recap?gameId=401071850 |archive-date=April 6, 2019 |url-status=live}}</ref> Antetokounmpo eventually guided the Bucks to a 60–22 season and the best record in the league. He helped the Bucks advance to the second round of the playoffs for the first time since 2001 after scoring 41 points in a 127–104 win in Game 4 over the [[2018–19 Detroit Pistons season|Detroit Pistons]] for a four-game sweep.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.espn.com/nba/recap?gameId=401126819 |title=Antetokounmpo scores 41, leads Bucks to sweep of Detroit |work=ESPN.com |date=April 22, 2019 |access-date=April 23, 2019 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190423074833/http://www.espn.com/nba/recap?gameId=401126819 |archive-date=April 23, 2019 |url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Bucks finish sweep of Pistons for first series victory since 2001 |first=Matt |last=Velazquez |work=Milwaukee Journal Sentinel |date=April 22, 2019 |url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/sports/nba/playoffs/2019/04/22/bucks-sweep-pistons-first-series-victory-since-2001/3546060002/ |access-date=April 24, 2019 winning the first two games.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.espn.com/nba/recap?gameId=401131845 |title=Leonard scores 27, Raptors advance to first NBA Finals |work=ESPN.com |date=May 25, 2019 |url=https://www.nba.com/bucks/release/giannis-antetokounmpo-named-nbas-most-valuable-player |title=Giannis Antetokounmpo named NBA's Most Valuable Player |work=nba.com |date=June 24, 2019 Abdul-Jabbar]] as the second Bucks player to win MVP and became the third youngest player to win the MVP over the previous 40 seasons, behind [[Derrick Rose]] and LeBron James.<ref>{{cite web |url-status=live}}</ref>

Antetokounmpo began the [[2019–20 NBA season|2019–20 season]] with a triple-double, recording 30 points, 13 rebounds, and 11 assists in a 117–111 season-opening win over the Houston Rockets on October 24, 2019.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.espn.com/nba/game/_/gameId/401160657 |title=Bucks vs. Rockets - Game Summary - October 24, 2019 - ESPN |website=ESPN.com |access-date=May 12, 2021 |archive-date=May 12, 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210512012229/https://www.espn.com/nba/game/_/gameId/401160657 |url-status=live}}</ref> On November 25, Antetokounmpo scored a season-high 50 points, along with 14 rebounds, in a 122–118 win over the [[Utah Jazz]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.espn.com/nba/game/_/gameId/401160890 |title=Jazz vs. Bucks - Game Summary - November 25, 2019 - ESPN |website=ESPN.com |access-date=May 12, 2021 |archive-date=May 12, 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210512012230/https://www.espn.com/nba/game/_/gameId/401160890 |url-status=live}}</ref> After a December 14 victory over the Cleveland Cavaliers, Antetokounmpo had led the Bucks to their 18th straight victory, 2 shy of the franchise record.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.espn.com/nba/game/_/gameId/401161027 |title=Cavaliers vs. Bucks - Game Summary - December 14, 2019 - ESPN |website=ESPN.com |access-date=May 12, 2021 |archive-date=May 12, 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210512150328/https://www.espn.com/nba/game/_/gameId/401161027 |url-status=live}}</ref> The winning streak ended on December 16 with a close loss to the Dallas Mavericks, despite Antetokounmpo recording an efficient 48 points and 14 rebounds.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.espn.com/nba/game/_/gameId/401161040 |title=Mavericks vs. Bucks - Game Summary - December 16, 2019 - ESPN |website=ESPN.com |access-date=May 12, 2021 |archive-date=May 12, 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210512060137/https://www.espn.com/nba/game/_/gameId/401161040 |url-status=live}}</ref> On December 19, Antetokounmpo made a career-high five three-pointers to lead Milwaukee over the Western top seed, the Los Angeles Lakers and helped the Bucks claim the NBA's best record at 25–4. On January 23, 2020, Antetokounmpo was named an [[2020 NBA All-Star Game|All-Star Game]] captain, alongside James, for the second consecutive year.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.nba.com/article/2019/01/24/2019-nba-all-star-starters-revealed-official-release |title=NBA All-Star 2019 starters, captains revealed |date=January 24, 2019 |website=NBA.com |access-date=November 5, 2021 |archive-date=September 28, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200928151935/https://www.nba.com/article/2019/01/24/2019-nba-all-star-starters-revealed-official-release |url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.nba.com/article/2020/01/23/2020-all-star-starters-official-release |title=Lakers' LeBron James, Bucks' Giannis Antetokounmpo named starters and captains for 2020 NBA All-Star Game |date=January 23, 2020 |website=NBA.com |access-date=November 5, 2021 |archive-date=February 12, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200212142101/https://www.nba.com/article/2020/01/23/2020-all-star-starters-official-release |url-status=live}}</ref>

During the season postponement that lasted from early March to the end of July, due to the [[COVID-19 pandemic]], Antetokounmpo claimed to not have a basketball hoop to practice with.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.espn.com/nba/story/_/id/28991709/giannis-not-playing-basketball-no-access-hoop |title=Giannis not playing basketball; no 'access to hoop' |date=April 3, 2020 |website=ESPN.com |access-date=August 2, 2020 |archive-date=July 25, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200725002804/https://www.espn.com/nba/story/_/id/28991709/giannis-not-playing-basketball-no-access-hoop |url-status=live}}</ref> He later clarified that he did have access to a gym and basketball hoop, explaining his earlier comments as a means to "get a little bit ahead of the competition."<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.espn.com/nba/story/_/id/29513440/bucks-giannis-antetokounmpo-says-had-access-hoop-contradicting-earlier-remarks |title=Giannis: No access to basketball hoop a ruse |date=July 22, 2020 |website=ESPN.com |access-date=August 2, 2020 |archive-date=July 24, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200724063556/https://www.espn.com/nba/story/_/id/29513440/bucks-giannis-antetokounmpo-says-had-access-hoop-contradicting-earlier-remarks |url-status=live}}</ref> Antetokounmpo and the Bucks resumed their campaign against the Boston Celtics on July 31, where Antetokounmpo led the Bucks to victory with 36 points and 15 rebounds.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.espn.com/nba/game/_/gameId/401224691 |title=Celtics vs. Bucks - Game Summary - July 31, 2020 - ESPN |website=ESPN.com |access-date=May 12, 2021 |archive-date=May 12, 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210512150316/https://www.espn.com/nba/game/_/gameId/401224691 |url-status=live}}</ref> Although the Bucks finished the seeding games with a 3–5 record, they set the best record in the NBA for the second consecutive year, finishing with a 56–17 record. On August 12, Antetokounmpo was suspended for one game without pay for headbutting [[Moritz Wagner (basketball)|Moritz Wagner]] during a game against the Washington Wizards.<ref>{{cite web |title=Bucks' Giannis Antetokounmpo suspended |url=https://pr.nba.com/giannis-antetokounmpo-suspended-bucks/ |access-date=October 11, 2021 |website=NBA |date=August 12, 2020 |archive-date=October 27, 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20211027182034/https://pr.nba.com/giannis-antetokounmpo-suspended-bucks/ |url-status=live}}</ref> During the playoffs, the Bucks advanced to the second round but lost 4–1 to the [[2019–20 Miami Heat season|Miami Heat]]. In Game 2, the Heat's [[Jimmy Butler]] was fouled while shooting by Antetokounmpo as time expired, leading to Butler's game-winning walk-off free throws.<ref>{{cite web |last=Woodyard |first=Eric |title=Butler's walk-off FTs cap wild finish against Bucks |url=https://www.espn.com/nba/story/_/id/29798622/heat-go-2-0-bucks-jimmy-butler-sinks-buzzer-beating-free-throws-wild-finish |website=ESPN.com |date=September 2, 2020 |access-date=September 3, 2020 |archive-date=September 4, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200904052041/https://www.espn.com/nba/story/_/id/29798622/heat-go-2-0-bucks-jimmy-butler-sinks-buzzer-beating-free-throws-wild-finish |url-status=live}}</ref> Antetokounmpo missed most of Game 4 after re-injuring his right ankle which he twisted in Game 3. Milwaukee won the game, but Antetokounmpo was also out for Game 5, when the Bucks were eliminated.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.cbssports.com/nba/news/giannis-antetokounmpo-injury-update-bucks-star-ruled-out-for-game-5-against-heat/ |title=Giannis Antetokounmpo injury update: Bucks star ruled out for Game 5 against Heat |website=CBSSports.com |date=September 8, 2020 |access-date=September 9, 2020 |archive-date=October 26, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201026200437/https://www.cbssports.com/nba/news/giannis-antetokounmpo-injury-update-bucks-star-ruled-out-for-game-5-against-heat/ |url-status=live}}</ref>

On September 18, 2020, Antetokounmpo won his second consecutive Most Valuable Player award. In doing so, he joined [[Hakeem Olajuwon]] and [[Michael Jordan]] as the only players to win MVP and [[NBA Defensive Player of the Year Award|NBA Defensive Player of the Year]] awards in the same season.<ref>{{cite web |title=Milwaukee's Giannis Antetokounmpo wins 2019-20 Kia NBA Most Valuable Player Award |url=https://www.nba.com/article/2020/09/18/2019-20-kia-mvp-award-official-release |website=NBA.com |access-date=September 20, 2020 |date=September 18, 2020 |archive-date=September 19, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200919074329/https://www.nba.com/article/2020/09/18/2019-20-kia-mvp-award-official-release |url-status=live}}</ref>

====NBA championship and Finals MVP (2020–2021)====
On December 15, 2020, Antetokounmpo re-signed with the Bucks, coming to terms on a 5-year, $228 million extension, the largest in league history.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.yahoo.com/lifestyle/nba-free-agency-2020-giannis-antetokounmpo-to-sign-supermax-extension-with-milwaukee-bucks-182426989.html |title=Giannis Antetokounmpo to sign supermax extension with Milwaukee Bucks |website=www.yahoo.com |date=December 15, 2020 |access-date=December 15, 2020 |archive-date=December 23, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201223033715/https://www.yahoo.com/lifestyle/nba-free-agency-2020-giannis-antetokounmpo-to-sign-supermax-extension-with-milwaukee-bucks-182426989.html |url-status=live}}</ref> At the [[2021 NBA All-Star Game|2021 All-Star Game]], he played on the team captained by James and scored 35 points on a perfect 16-of-16 shooting from the field to lead the team to a 170–150 win and became the first non-American to win the [[NBA All-Star Game Kobe Bryant Most Valuable Player Award|All-Star MVP]].<ref>{{cite news |first1=Ben |last1=Golliver |first2=Ava |last2=Wallace |first3=Des |last3=Bieler |title=Team LeBron dominates an NBA All-Star Game that feels incomplete |date=March 8, 2021 |newspaper=The Washington Post |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/sports/2021/03/07/nba-all-star-game-dunk-contest/ |access-date=March 8, 2021 |archive-date=March 8, 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210308083642/https://www.washingtonpost.com/sports/2021/03/07/nba-all-star-game-dunk-contest/ |url-status=live}}</ref> The Bucks finished the [[2020–21 NBA season|2020–21 season]] with a 46–26 record, clinching the third seed in the Eastern Conference. In the first round of the playoffs, they faced a rematch against the Miami Heat. In a stark reversal of their upset loss the prior year, Antetokounmpo led the Bucks to a four-game sweep, closing out the series with his first playoff triple-double in Game 4.<ref>{{cite web |last=Arnovitz |first=Kevin |date=May 29, 2021 |title=Giannis Antetokounmpo, Milwaukee Bucks sweep Miami Heat to reach Eastern Conference semifinals |url=https://www.espn.com.au/nba/story/_/id/31534025/giannis-antetokounmpo-milwaukee-bucks-sweep-miami-heat-reach-eastern-conference-semifinals |access-date=May 29, 2021 |website=ESPN.com |language=en |archive-date=June 2, 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210602212943/https://www.espn.com.au/nba/story/_/id/31534025/giannis-antetokounmpo-milwaukee-bucks-sweep-miami-heat-reach-eastern-conference-semifinals |url-status=live}}</ref> Antetokounmpo also led the Bucks to a seven-game series win over the [[2020–21 Brooklyn Nets season|Brooklyn Nets]] in the Eastern Conference Semifinals, where he averaged 31.9 points, 12.9 rebounds, and 3.6 assists per game. On June 29, 2021, Antetokounmpo suffered an injury to his left knee during the third quarter of Game 4 of the Eastern Conference Finals against the [[2020–21 Atlanta Hawks season|Atlanta Hawks]] after slamming into [[Clint Capela]] and landing awkwardly, resulting in a gruesome hyperextension.<ref>{{cite web |last=Arnovitz |first=Kevin |date=June 30, 2021 |title=Can the Bucks get past the Hawks without Giannis? |url=https://www.espn.com/nba/story/_/id/31735732/nba-playoffs-2021-five-big-takeaways-game-4-hawks-bucks |access-date=June 30, 2021 |website=ESPN.com |language=en |archive-date=June 30, 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210630042738/https://www.espn.com/nba/story/_/id/31735732/nba-playoffs-2021-five-big-takeaways-game-4-hawks-bucks |url-status=live}}</ref> Antetokounmpo would not return to the game, and the Bucks lost 110–88.<ref>{{cite web |last=Maloney |first=Jack |date=June 30, 2021 |title=Hawks vs. Bucks score, takeaways: Trae Young-less Hawks tie series vs. Bucks; Giannis Antetokounmpo hurts knee |url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |title=Giannis out as Bucks try to punch Finals ticket
