On April 20, during Game 2 of the first round of the playoffs, Antetokounmpo logged 33 points, 18 rebounds, 9 assists, and 2 blocks in a 114–110 loss against the [[Chicago Bulls]]. He surpassed Kareem Abdul-Jabbar for the most playoff points in Bucks franchise history.<ref>{{cite web |title=DeRozan scores playoff career-high 41 as Bulls take Game 2 |url=https://www.nba.com/game/chi-vs-mil-0042100122 |website=NBA.com |language=en |date=April 21, 2022 |access-date=April 22, 2022 |archive-date=May 5, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220505204951/https://www.nba.com/game/chi-vs-mil-0042100122 |url-status=live}}</ref> On May 1, in Game 1 of the [[2022 NBA playoffs|Eastern Conference Semifinals]], Antetokounmpo recorded his second career playoff triple-double with 24 points, 13 rebounds, and 12 assists in a 101–89 win over the [[Boston Celtics]]. He became the first player in franchise history with multiple career playoff triple-doubles<ref>{{cite web |title=Bucks control Celtics to win Game 1 on the road |url=https://www.nba.com/game/mil-vs-bos-0042100211 |website=NBA.com |access-date=May 1, 2022 |date=May 1, 2022 |archive-date=May 7, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220507030345/https://www.nba.com/game/mil-vs-bos-0042100211 |url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |title=Giannis Antetokounmpo has the most career triple-doubles for the Bucks in the playoffs, with 2 triple-doubles. |url=https://www.statmuse.com/nba/ask?q=milwaukee+bucks+franchise+player+playoff+triple-double+record |website=StatMuse.com |date=May 2, 2022 |access-date=May 12, 2022 |archive-date=May 12, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220512123020/https://www.statmuse.com/nba/ask?q=milwaukee+bucks+franchise+player+playoff+triple-double+record |url-status=live}}</ref> On May 13, Antetokounmpo posted 44 points, 20 rebounds, and 6 assists in a 108–95 Game 6 loss. He joined [[Shaquille O'Neal]] and [[Wilt Chamberlain]] as the only players in NBA playoff history to post a 40/20/5 game.<ref>{{cite web |title=Celtics force Game 7 behind Tatum's 46-point masterpiece |url=https://www.nba.com/game/bos-vs-mil-0042100216 |website=NBA.com |access-date=May 14, 2022 |date=May 14, 2022 |archive-date=March 12, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230312003740/https://www.nba.com/game/bos-vs-mil-0042100216 |url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |title=Players in NBA playoff history with 40 or more points and 20 or more rebounds 5 or more assists in one game |url=https://www.statmuse.com/nba/ask/players-in-nba-playoff-history-with-40-points-and-20-rebounds-5-assists-in-one-game |website=StatMuse.com |date=May 14, 2022 |access-date=May 14, 2022 |archive-date=May 14, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220514132028/https://www.statmuse.com/nba/ask/players-in-nba-playoff-history-with-40-points-and-20-rebounds-5-assists-in-one-game |url-status=live}}</ref> The Bucks would go on to lose to Celtics in Game 7 despite Antetokounmpo's 25-point, 20-rebound, and 9-assist outing. He became the first player in NBA history to have 200 points, 100 rebounds, and 50 assists in a playoff series, averaging 33.9 points, 14.7 rebounds, and 7.1 assists against Boston. Antetokounmpo also finished the postseason by averaging 31.7 points, 14.2 rebounds and 6.8 assists across the 12 playoff games his Milwaukee Bucks played. He is therefore the first player in NBA history to average a 31-14-6 line across an entire postseason.<ref>{{cite web |title=Celtics dominate Bucks in Game 7 to reach East finals |url=https://www.nba.com/game/mil-vs-bos-0042100217 |website=NBA.com |access-date=May 15, 2022 |date=May 15, 2022 |archive-date=April 28, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220428024139/https://www.nba.com/game/mil-vs-bos-0042100215 |url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |date=May 15, 2022 |title=Giannis Antetokounmpo posts historic series numbers despite Bucks' second-round loss to Celtics |url=https://www.cbssports.com/nba/news/giannis-antetokounmpo-posts-historic-series-numbers-despite-bucks-second-round-loss-to-celtics/ |access-date=May 16, 2022 |website=CBSSports.com |language=en |archive-date=October 19, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231019184120/https://www.cbssports.com/nba/news/giannis-antetokounmpo-posts-historic-series-numbers-despite-bucks-second-round-loss-to-celtics/ |url-status=live}}</ref>

On May 21, Antetokounmpo was selected to his fourth consecutive [[NBA All-Defensive First Team]], which was the fifth career all-defensive team selection for him. It tied him with [[Naismith Memorial Basketball Hall of Fame|Hall of Famer]] and former two-time [[NBA Defensive Player of the Year Award]] winner [[Sidney Moncrief]] for most selections in franchise history.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.nba.com/news/nba-2021-22-all-defensive-teams |title=NBA announces 2021-22 Kia All-Defensive 1st and 2nd Teams |website=NBA.com |date=May 21, 2022 |access-date=May 21, 2022 |archive-date=May 21, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220521004524/https://www.nba.com/news/nba-2021-22-all-defensive-teams |url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://currently.att.yahoo.com/att/bucks-stars-giannis-antetokounmpo-jrue-002450160.html#:~:text=Antetokounmpo%20was%20named%20to%20the,most%20selections%20in%20franchise%20history. |title=Bucks stars Giannis Antetokounmpo, Jrue Holiday named to NBA all-defensive teams |website=Yahoo |date=May 21, 2022 |access-date=May 21, 2022 |archive-date=May 21, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220521093015/https://currently.att.yahoo.com/att/bucks-stars-giannis-antetokounmpo-jrue-002450160.html#:~:text=Antetokounmpo%20was%20named%20to%20the,most%20selections%20in%20franchise%20history. |url-status=live}}</ref> On May 24, Antetokounmpo was selected to his fourth consecutive [[All-NBA First Team]] and sixth consecutive overall. He became the first player in club history to earn six All-NBA team honors, passing Kareem Abdul-Jabbar and Sidney Moncrief for the most in franchise history.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.nba.com/news/antetokounmpo-jokic-doncic-2021-22-kia-all-nba-first-team |title=Giannis Antetokounmpo, Nikola Jokic, Luka Doncic lead 2021-22 Kia All-NBA 1st Team |website=NBA.com |date=May 24, 2022 |access-date=May 24, 2022 |archive-date=May 25, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220525010832/https://www.nba.com/news/antetokounmpo-jokic-doncic-2021-22-kia-all-nba-first-team |url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.wearegreenbay.com/sports/bucks/bucks-star-antetokounmpo-earns-unanimous-all-nba-first-team/ |title=Bucks star Antetokounmpo earns unanimous All-NBA first team |website=WeAreGeenBay |date=May 24, 2022 |access-date=May 24, 2022 |archive-date=May 25, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220525055705/https://www.wearegreenbay.com/sports/bucks/bucks-star-antetokounmpo-earns-unanimous-all-nba-first-team/ |url-status=live}}</ref>

==== Playoff upset (2022–2023) ====
On October 22, in the second game of the [[2022–23 NBA season|2022–23 season]], Antetokounmpo recorded 44 points and 12 rebounds on 17-of-21 shooting from the field, playing less than 28 minutes in a 125–105 win over the Houston Rockets; marking just the fifth time in NBA history a player had scored at least 44 points while playing less than 28 minutes. He went 8 of 13 from the foul line to increase his total to 3,508 free throws eclipsing Sidney Moncrief, who made 3,505 free throws with the Bucks, to become the franchise career free throws leader.<ref>{{cite web |title=Antetokounmpo scores 44 points, Bucks rout Rockets 125–105 |url=https://www.espn.com/nba/recap/_/gameId/401468188 |website=ESPN.com |language=en |date=October 22, 2022 |access-date=October 23, 2022 |archive-date=October 23, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20221023195820/https://www.espn.com/nba/recap/_/gameId/401468188 |url-status=live}}</ref> In the very next game, Antetokounmpo had 43 points, 14 rebounds, 5 assists and 3 blocks in a 110–99 win against the Brooklyn Nets; 34 of his points came in the second half as the Bucks turned a 12-point deficit at halftime into an 11-point victory.<ref>{{cite web |title=Bucks use lopsided run after Nash ejected, beat Nets 110–99 |url=https://www.espn.com/nba/recap/_/gameId/401468215 |website=ESPN.com |language=en |date=October 26, 2022 |access-date=October 27, 2022 |archive-date=October 27, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20221027112103/https://www.espn.com/nba/recap/_/gameId/401468215 |url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Kia MVP Ladder: Top 5 performances to open 2022-23 |date=October 28, 2022 |website=NBA.com |url=https://www.nba.com/news/kia-mvp-ladder-oct-28-2022-edition |access-date=October 29, 2022 |archive-date=November 10, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20221110002945/https://www.nba.com/news/kia-mvp-ladder-oct-28-2022-edition |url-status=live}}</ref> On November 4, Antetokounmpo recorded his 30th career triple-double with 26 points, 14 rebounds and 11 assists in a 115–102 win over the [[Minnesota Timberwolves]] to improve to 8–0, the best start to a season in Milwaukee Bucks franchise history.<ref>{{cite web |title=Giannis has triple-double, Bucks beat Wolves for 8–0 start |url=https://www.espn.com/nba/recap/_/gameId/401468215 |website=ESPN.com |language=en |date=November 4, 2022 |access-date=October 27, 2022 |archive-date=October 27, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20221027112103/https://www.espn.com/nba/recap/_/gameId/401468215 |url-status=live}}</ref> On December 28, Antetokounmpo scored 45 points, grabbed a career-high 22 rebounds and delivered 7 assists in an 119–113 overtime loss to the Chicago Bulls.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.espn.com/nba/recap/_/gameId/401468671 |title=DeRozan scores 42 points, Bulls beat Bucks 119–113 in OT |website=ESPN.com |date=December 28, 2022 |access-date=December 29, 2022 |archive-date=January 3, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230103203727/https://www.espn.com/nba/recap/_/gameId/401468671 |url-status=live}}</ref> The next game, Antetokounmpo had 43 points along with 20 rebounds and 5 assists in a 123–114 win over the Minnesota Timberwolves.  He joined [[Wilt Chamberlain]] and [[Elgin Baylor]] as the only players in NBA history with back-to-back games of at least 40 points, 20 rebounds and 5 assists. Antetokounmpo also became just the seventh player with multiple games of 40 points, 20 rebounds, 5 assists and 60% shooting. Since the [[ABA–NBA merger|NBA–ABA Merger]] in [[1976–77 NBA season|1976–77 season]], [[Charles Barkley]] and Antetokounmpo are the only players to do this multiple times.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.espn.com/nba/story/_/id/35351424/giannis-antetokounmpo-joins-elite-club-2nd-straight-40-20-5-game |title=Giannis Antetokounmpo joins elite club with 2nd straight 40-20-5 game |website=ESPN.com |date=December 30, 2022 |access-date=December 31, 2022 |archive-date=December 31, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20221231054302/https://www.espn.com/nba/story/_/id/35351424/giannis-antetokounmpo-joins-elite-club-2nd-straight-40-20-5-game |url-status=live}}</ref>

On January 3, 2023, Antetokounmpo recorded a then career-high 55 points, alongside 10 rebounds and seven assists in a 123–113 win over the [[Washington Wizards]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://clutchpoints.com/bucks-news-giannis-antetokounmpos-immediate-response-to-decimating-wizards-with-55-point-eruption |title=Bucks star Giannis Antetokounmpo's immediate response to decimating Wizards with 55-point eruption |website=ClutchPoints |last=Pagaduan |first=Jedd |date=January 3, 2023 |access-date=January 3, 2023 |archive-date=January 4, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230104061922/https://clutchpoints.com/bucks-news-giannis-antetokounmpos-immediate-response-to-decimating-wizards-with-55-point-eruption |url-status=live}}</ref> The next night, Antetokounmpo posted his 31st career triple-double with 30 points, 21 rebounds and 10 assists in a 104–101 overtime win against the [[Toronto Raptors]]. He tied [[John Havlicek]] and [[Draymond Green]] for 15th place on the NBA's all-time triple-double list. Antetokounmpo also became the first player to total 200+ points, 80+ rebounds, and 30+ assists over a 5-game span since [[Kareem Abdul-Jabbar]] in 1972.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://theathletic.com/4059477/2023/01/04/giannis-antetokoumpo-triple-double-30-20-10-bucks-raptors/ |title=Giannis Antetokounmpo notches 30-20-10 performance in OT win vs. Raptors |publisher=Theathletic.com |last1=Nehm |first1=Eric |last2=Koreen |first2=Eric |url-access=subscription |date=January 5, 2023 |access-date=January 6, 2023 |archive-date=January 6, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230106164434/https://theathletic.com/4059477/2023/01/04/giannis-antetokoumpo-triple-double-30-20-10-bucks-raptors/ |url-status=live}}</ref> On January 23, Antetokounmpo was named the [[Eastern Conference (NBA)|Eastern Conference]] captain for the [[2023 NBA All-Star Game]], which marked his seventh overall selection.<ref>{{Cite web |title=2023 NBA All-Star starters announced |url=https://www.nba.com/news/2023-nba-all-star-starters-announced |access-date=January 29, 2023 |website=NBA.com |archive-date=January 27, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230127003044/https://www.nba.com/news/2023-nba-all-star-starters-announced |url-status=live}}</ref> On January 29, Antetokounmpo posted 50 points and 13 rebounds while playing only 30 minutes in a 135–110 win over [[New Orleans Pelicans]]. He shot 20-of-26 from the field, 3-of-4 from three, 7-of-12 from the free throw line. This marked the 10th time this season that Antetokounmpo has scored at least 40 points, matching the career high he set last year for 40-point games in a single season.<ref>{{cite web |title=Antetokounmpo scores 50 for Bucks; Pelicans lose 8th in row |url=https://www.espn.com/nba/recap/_/gameId/401468910 |website=ESPN.com |language=en |date=January 29, 2023 |access-date=January 30, 2023 |archive-date=January 30, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230130083029/https://www.espn.com/nba/recap/_/gameId/401468910 |url-status=live}}</ref> On February 2, Antetokounmpo scored 20 of his 54 points in the fourth quarter, along with 19 rebounds and the Milwaukee Bucks overcame a 21-point deficit to beat the [[Los Angeles Clippers]] 106–105 for their sixth consecutive victory. He joined Kareem Abdul-Jabbar as the only players in Bucks history to have at least three 50-point games in a season.<ref>{{cite web |title=Antetokounmpo scores 54 points, Bucks beat Clippers 106-105 |url=https://www.espn.com/nba/recap/_/gameId/401468939 |website=ESPN.com |language=en |date=February 2, 2023 |access-date=February 4, 2023 |archive-date=February 4, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230204151539/https://www.espn.com/nba/recap/_/gameId/401468939 |url-status=live}}</ref> The next game, Antetokounmpo logged his 32nd career triple-double with 35 points, 15 rebounds and 11 assists in a 123–115 win over the [[Miami Heat]].<ref>{{cite web |title=Antetokounmpo has triple-double; Bucks win 7th straight |url=https://www.espn.com/nba/recap/_/gameId/401468952 |website=ESPN.com |language=en |date=February 4, 2023 |access-date=February 5, 2023 |archive-date=February 5, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230205123834/https://www.espn.com/nba/recap/_/gameId/401468952 |url-status=live}}</ref> On February 16, Antetokounmpo surpassed [[Paul Pressey]] for the most assists in Bucks franchise history.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.nba.com/news/giannis-antetokounmpo-bucks-assists-record |title=Giannis Antetokounmpo breaks Bucks' career assists record, exits with sprained right wrist |website=NBA.com |date=February 16, 2023 |access-date=February 19, 2023 |archive-date=February 19, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230219001556/https://www.nba.com/news/giannis-antetokounmpo-bucks-assists-record |url-status=live}}</ref> On February 19, his team won the [[2023 NBA All-Star Game]] 184–175, defeating Team LeBron.<ref>{{Cite web |title=2023 NBA All-Star Game score: Jayson Tatum breaks scoring record, wins MVP; LeBron James' streak ends |url=https://www.cbssports.com/nba/news/2023-nba-all-star-game-score-jayson-tatum-breaks-scoring-record-wins-mvp-lebron-james-streak-ends/live/ |access-date=February 21, 2023 |website=www.cbssports.com |date=February 20, 2023 |archive-date=March 29, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230329085749/https://www.cbssports.com/nba/news/2023-nba-all-star-game-score-jayson-tatum-breaks-scoring-record-wins-mvp-lebron-james-streak-ends/live/ |url-status=live}}</ref> The win marked Team Giannis' first (and only) win in an NBA All-Star Game, having previously lost in 2019 and 2020.<ref>{{Cite web |title=NBA All-Star Game 2023: Team Giannis gets 1st win, handing Team LeBron 1st loss as Jayson Tatum sets record |url=https://sports.yahoo.com/nba-all-star-game-2023-team-giannis-gets-1st-win-handing-team-lebron-1st-loss-as-jayson-tatum-sets-record-040325859.html |access-date=March 30, 2023 |website=Yahoo Sports |date=February 20, 2023 |language=en-US |archive-date=March 30, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230330025256/https://sports.yahoo.com/nba-all-star-game-2023-team-giannis-gets-1st-win-handing-team-lebron-1st-loss-as-jayson-tatum-sets-record-040325859.html |url-status=live}}</ref> On March 19, Antetokounmpo had his 33rd career triple-double, making all nine of his field goal attempts. He recorded 22 points, 13 rebounds and 10 assists in a 118–111 win over the Toronto Raptors. He also played in his franchise-record 712th game, surpassing [[Junior Bridgeman]].<ref>{{cite web |title=Antetokounmpo, Lopez lead Bucks past Raptors, 118-111 |url=https://www.espn.com/nba/recap/_/gameId/401469223 |website=ESPN.com |language=en |date=March 19, 2023 |access-date=March 21, 2023 |archive-date=March 21, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230321180408/https://www.espn.com/nba/recap/_/gameId/401469223 |url-status=live}}</ref> On March 29, Antetokounmpo had 38 points, 17 rebounds and 12 assists in a 149–136 victory over the [[Indiana Pacers]].<ref>{{cite web |last1=Wilson |first1=Phillip |title=Holiday has career-high 51 points, Bucks beat Pacers 149-136 |date=March 30, 2023 |url=https://apnews.com/article/jrue-holiday-giannis-antetokounmpo-bucks-pacers-2a261851c52564a75cbb344622dc7cba |publisher=AP News |access-date=March 30, 2023 |archive-date=March 31, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230331030101/https://apnews.com/article/jrue-holiday-giannis-antetokounmpo-bucks-pacers-2a261851c52564a75cbb344622dc7cba |url-status=live}}</ref> On April 9, Antetokounmpo finished the regular season with a career-high 31.1 points per game and he also led the Bucks to a league-best 58–24 record.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://clutchpoints.com/bucks-news-giannis-antetokounmpo-leads-all-superstars-in-nba-finals-mvp-odds-ahead-of-playoffs |title=Giannis Antetokounmpo leads all superstars in NBA Finals MVP odds ahead of playoffs |website=ClutchPoints |last=Villas |first=Rexwell |date=April 11, 2023 |access-date=April 12, 2023 |archive-date=April 12, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230412072039/https://clutchpoints.com/bucks-news-giannis-antetokounmpo-leads-all-superstars-in-nba-finals-mvp-odds-ahead-of-playoffs |url-status=live}}</ref> Antetokounmpo also became just the second player in NBA history (Kareem Abdul-Jabbar is the other) to average 30 points or more, 10-plus rebounds and 5-plus assists while shooting at least 55% from the field.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.nba.com/news/kia-mvp-ladder-april-14-2023-edition |title=Kia MVP Ladder: Nikola Jokic edges out Joel Embiid for No. 1 |website=NBA.com |date=April 16, 2023 |access-date=April 16, 2023 |archive-date=April 14, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230414185732/https://www.nba.com/news/kia-mvp-ladder-april-14-2023-edition |url-status=live}}</ref>

In the first round of the [[2023 NBA playoffs]], Antetokounmpo and the Bucks faced the Miami Heat. In Game 1, Antetokounmpo suffered a lower back contusion that ruled him out for the remainder of Game 1, and the next two games.<ref>{{cite web |title=Giannis Antetokounmpo misses Game 3 with lower back injury |url=https://www.nba.com/news/giannis-antetokounmpo-back-ruled-out-for-game-3-vs-heat |website=NBA.com |language=en |date=April 23, 2023 |access-date=April 30, 2023 |archive-date=April 30, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230430111423/https://www.nba.com/news/giannis-antetokounmpo-back-ruled-out-for-game-3-vs-heat |url-status=live}}</ref> He returned in Game 4, scoring a triple-double of 26 points, 10 rebounds and 13 assists in a losing effort.<ref>{{cite web |title=Butler scores 56, Heat stun Bucks 119-114 for 3-1 lead |url=https://www.espn.com/nba/recap/_/gameId/401541187 |website=ESPN.com |language=en |date=April 25, 2023 |access-date=April 30, 2023 |archive-date=May 2, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230502022850/https://www.espn.com/nba/recap/_/gameId/401541187 |url-status=live}}</ref> The Bucks were eliminated in five games, despite Antetokounmpo's 38-point, 20-rebound outing in a 128–126 closeout overtime loss in Game 5.<ref>{{cite web |title=Heat rally again to win in OT, eliminate top-seeded Bucks |url=https://www.espn.com/nba/recap/_/gameId/401541240 |website=ESPN.com |language=en |date=April 27, 2023 |access-date=April 27, 2023 |archive-date=May 12, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230512142019/https://www.espn.com/nba/recap/_/gameId/401541240 |url-status=live}}</ref>

==== Franchise records and NBA Cup MVP (2023–present) ====
On October 23, 2023, Antetokounmpo signed a three-year, $186 million extension with the Bucks.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Wojnarowski |first=Adrian |date=October 23, 2023 |title=Agent: Giannis Antetokounmpo secures 3-year, $186M extension |url=https://www.espn.com/nba/story/_/id/38728726/giannis-antetokounmpo-nets-3-year-186m-extension |access-date=October 23, 2023 |publisher=ESPN |archive-date=October 23, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231023232406/https://www.espn.com/nba/story/_/id/38728726/giannis-antetokounmpo-nets-3-year-186m-extension |url-status=live}}</ref> On November 9, Antetokounmpo scored 54 points and put up 12 rebounds in a 126–124 loss to the [[Indiana Pacers]]. He also joined [[Michael Jordan]] as the only players since the [[ABA–NBA merger]] to put up at least eight 50-point and 10-rebound games in their career.<ref>{{cite web |url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://clutchpoints.com/bucks-news-giannis-antetokounmpo-epic-michael-jordan-territory-with-eye-popping-numbers-vs-pacers |title=Bucks' Giannis |url-status=live}}</ref> On November 18, Antetokounmpo recorded 40 points, 15 rebounds and 7 assists in a 132–125 win over the [[Dallas Mavericks]].<ref>{{Cite news |date=November 19, 2023 |title=Antetokounmpo scores 40 as Bucks top Mavericks 132-125 |url=https://www.espn.com/nba/recap/_/gameId/401584833 |url-status=live |agency=Associated Press |language=en}}</ref> He became the youngest player (28 years, 347 days) to record 16,000+ points, 7,000+ rebounds and 3,000+ assists in an NBA career.<ref>{{Cite magazine |last=Dugandzic |first=Matthew |url=https://www.si.com/nba/bucks/news/giannis-antetokounmpo-sets-nba-record-in-the-win-versus-the-dallas-mavericks |title=Giannis Antetokounmpo sets NBA record in the November 20, Antetokounmpo put up 42 points, 13 rebounds, and eight assists in a 142–129 win over the [[Washington Wizards]]. He also tied [[Kareem Abdul-Jabbar]] for the most games with at least 30 points, 10 rebounds, and five assists in Bucks history.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://clutchpoints.com/bucks-news-giannis-antetokounmpo-kareem-abdul-jabbar-record-tying-feat |title=Bucks' Giannis Antetokounmpo joins Kareem Abdul-Jabbar club with record-tying feat |website=ClutchPoints |last=Villas |first=Rexwell |date=November 20, 2023 |access-date=November 20, 2023 |archive-date=November 21, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231121040938/https://clutchpoints.com/bucks-news-giannis-antetokounmpo-kareem-abdul-jabbar-record-tying-feat |url-status=live}}</ref>

On December 13, Antetokounmpo scored a career-high and Bucks record 64 points and grabbed 14 rebounds in a 140–126 victory over the Indiana Pacers. He became the first player since [[Shaquille O'Neal]] in 2000 to tally 60-plus points without a made three-point basket. Antetokounmpo is also the first player in NBA history to make at least 20 field goals and 20 free throws  while shooting both at 70% or higher.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Young |first=Ryan |date=December 14, 2023 |title=Giannis Antetokounmpo drops career-high 64 points, Bobby Portis ejected as Bucks fly past Pacers |url=https://sports.yahoo.com/giannis-antetokounmpo-drops-career-high-64-points-bobby-portis-ejected-as-bucks-fly-past-pacers-040227748.html |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231214040436/https://sports.yahoo.com/giannis-antetokounmpo-drops-career-high-64-points-bobby-portis-ejected-as-bucks-fly-past-pacers-040227748.html |archive-date=December 14, 2023 |access-date=December 14, 2023 |website=Yahoo! Sports |language=en-GB}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |title=Kia MVP Ladder: Giannis Antetokounmpo climbing after 64-point masterpiece |url=https://www.nba.com/news/kia-mvp-ladder-dec-15-2023-edition |website=NBA.com |language=en |date=December 15, 2023 |access-date=December 17, 2023 |archive-date=December 17, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231217231814/https://www.nba.com/news/kia-mvp-ladder-dec-15-2023-edition |url-status=live}}</ref> On December 17, Antetokounmpo put up 26 points and 17 rebounds in a 128–119 win over the [[Houston Rockets]]. He also surpassed [[Kareem Abdul-Jabbar]] to become the all-time rebounds leader in Bucks history.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://clutchpoints.com/bucks-news-giannis-antetokounmpo-franchise-record-proves-huge-appetite-for-ball |title=Giannis Antetokounmpo' latest Bucks franchise record proves huge appetite for the ball |website=ClutchPoints |last=Postrado |first=Jay |date=December 17, 2023 |access-date=December 17, 2023 |archive-date=December 18, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231218101511/https://clutchpoints.com/bucks-news-giannis-antetokounmpo-franchise-record-proves-huge-appetite-for-ball |url-status=live}}</ref> On December 19, Antetokounmpo had a career-high 16 assists, 14 rebounds and 11 points for his 37th career triple-double in a 132–119 win over the [[San Antonio Spurs]].<ref>{{Cite web |title=Lillard joins 20,000-point club, Giannis has triple-double as Bucks defeat Spurs 132-119 |url=https://www.espn.com/nba/recap/_/gameId/401584989 |date=December 19, 2023 |access-date=December 21, 2023 |website=ESPN.com |language=en |archive-date=December 20, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231220171228/https://www.espn.com/nba/recap/_/gameId/401584989 |url-status=live}}</ref>

On January 24, 2024, Antetokounmpo recorded his 42nd career triple-double with 35 points, 18 rebounds, 10 assists and 2 blocks in a 126–116 win over the [[Cleveland Cavaliers]].<ref>{{Cite web |title=Antetokounmpo gets triple-double as Bucks beat Cavs 126-116 in 1st game since Griffin was fired |url=https://www.espn.com/nba/recap/_/gameId/401585252 |date=January 24, 2024 |access-date=January 27, 2024 |website=ESPN.com |language=en |archive-date=January 27, 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240127215227/https://www.espn.com/nba/recap/_/gameId/401585252 |url-status=live}}</ref>  On January 25, Antetokounmpo was named the [[Eastern Conference (NBA)|Eastern Conference]] captain for the [[2024 NBA All-Star Game]], marking his eight consecutive selection and fourth as the captain.<ref>{{cite web |title=2024 NBA All-Star starters announced |url=https://www.nba.com/news/2024-nba-all-star-starters-announced |website=NBA.com |access-date=January 27, 2024 |archive-date=January 27, 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240127180845/https://www.nba.com/news/2024-nba-all-star-starters-announced |url-status=live}}</ref> On March 26, Antetokounmpo posted his 44th career triple-double with 29 points,  a season-high 21 rebounds, 11 assists and 3 blocks in a 128–124 double overtime loss against the [[Los Angeles Lakers]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.espn.com/nba/recap/_/gameId/401585673 |title=Reaves' triple-double, tiebreaking 3 helps rally Lakers past Bucks in 2OTs without LeBron James |website=ESPN.com |date=March 26, 2024 |access-date=March 28, 2024}}</ref> On April 9, Antetokounmpo suffered a calf injury, and missed the remainder of the regular season, as well as the entirety of the [[2024 NBA playoffs]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.espn.com/nba/recap/_/gameId/401655116 |title=Pacers celebrate 1st playoff series victory in a decade, beating Bucks 120-98 in Game 6 |website=ESPN.com |date=May 2, 2024 |access-date=May 15, 2024}}</ref>

On November 13, 2024, Antetokounmpo recorded 59 points, 14 rebounds and seven assists in a 127–120 overtime win over the [[Detroit Pistons]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Giannis outscores Pistons in OT, finishes with 59 |url=https://www.espn.com/nba/story/_/id/42379408/giannis-erupts-season-best-59-bucks-outlast-pistons |access-date=November 14, 2024 |work=ESPN.com |date=November 13, 2024 |language=en}}</ref> On November 16, he had 22 points, 15 rebounds and 12 assists in a 115–114 loss to the [[Charlotte Hornets]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Hornets 115-114 Bucks (Nov 16, 2024) Game Recap |url=https://www.espn.com/nba/recap/_/gameId/401704795 |access-date=December 1, 2024 |work=ESPN |date=November 16, 2024 |language=en}}</ref> On November 22, Antetokounmpo logged 37 points, 10 rebounds and 11 assists in a 129–117 win over the Indiana Pacers.<ref>{{cite news |title=Antetokounmpo gets triple-double as surging Bucks beat slumping Pacers 129-117 in NBA Cup play |url=https://www.espn.com/nba/recap?gameId=401703398 |access-date=November 23, 2024 |work=ESPN.com |date=November 22, 2024 |language=en}}</ref> On November 30, he had his third triple-double in six games with 42 points, 12 rebounds and 11 assists in a 124–114 win over the [[Washington Wizards]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Bucks 124-114 Wizards (Nov 30, 2024) Game Recap |url=https://www.espn.com/nba/recap/_/gameId/401704868 |access-date=December 1, 2024 |work=ESPN |date=November 30, 2024 |language=en}}</ref> On December 17, Antetokounmpo and the Bucks won the NBA Cup with a 97–81 victory over the [[Oklahoma City Thunder]], with Antetokounmpo receiving the Tournament MVP award and being selected to the All-Tournament team. He posted a triple-double with 26 points, 19 rebounds and 10 assists.<ref>{{Cite news |date=December 20, 2024 |title=Giannis, Bucks use 3-point barrage to beat Thunder 97-81 for NBA Cup title |url=https://www.espn.com/nba/recap/_/gameId/401734908 |access-date=December 17, 2024 |work=ESPN.com |agency=Associated Press |language=en}}</ref>

==National team career==
===Junior national team===
Antetokounmpo represented Greece for the first time in July 2013 with the [[Greece men's national under-20 basketball team|Greek Under-20 national team]] at the [[2013 FIBA Europe Under-20 Championship]]. He helped Greece to an 8–2 record and a fifth-place overall finish while averaging 8.0 points, 7.6 rebounds, and 2.2 assists across the 10 games. He finished the tournament ranked second in defensive rebounds (7.0) and seventh in blocked shots (1.4).<ref name="fiba"/>

===Senior national team===
In 2014, Antetokounmpo played for the senior men's [[Greek national basketball team]] for the first time, helping Greece finish ninth overall in the [[2014 FIBA Basketball World Cup]] with a 5–1 record. He averaged 6.3 points and 4.3 rebounds across the six games while shooting 45.8% from the field.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.fiba.basketball/basketballworldcup/2014/player/Giannis-Antetokounmpo |title=2014 FIBA Basketball World Cup – Giannis Antetokounmpo |work=FIBA.com |access-date=April 4, 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160315191340/http://www.fiba.com/basketballworldcup/2014/Giannis-ANTETOKOUNMPO |archive-date=March 15, 2016 |url-status=live}}</ref>

Antetokounmpo again joined the Greek national team for [[EuroBasket 2015]]. Greece's roster consisted of many experienced players, most of them previously crowned European champions with their clubs, like [[Vassilis Spanoulis]], [[Ioannis Bourousis]] and [[Nikos Zisis]], and Greece was a favorite for a medal, after showing great form in [[exhibition game|friendly]] games.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.eurobasket2015.org/en/compID_qMRZdYCZI6EoANOrUf9le2.season_2015.roundID_9322.coid_LxmCcuUWJ82BOJFEnqxvm0.articleMode_on.html |title=Greece Win Acropolis Tournament |work=eurobasket2015.org |date=August 30, 2015 |access-date=December 31, 2015 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20151023065305/http://www.eurobasket2015.org/en/compID_qMRZdYCZI6EoANOrUf9le2.season_2015.roundID_9322.coid_LxmCcuUWJ82BOJFEnqxvm0.articleMode_on.html |archive-date=October 23, 2015 |url-status=usurped}}</ref> At EuroBasket 2015, Greece was unbeaten in the group stages, and reached the quarter-finals, where a tight game ended in favor of the eventual champions, [[Spanish national basketball team|Spain]], eventually finishing fifth with a 7–1 record. Antetokounmpo finished the tournament with three double-doubles, and a career-high 17 rebounds against Spain, leading his team in rebounds for the tournament. In eight games, he averaged 9.8 points, 6.9 rebounds and 1.1 assists per game.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.eurobasket2015.org/en/compID_qMRZdYCZI6EoANOrUf9le2.season_2015.roundID_9322.teamID_291.playerID_99285.html |title=Giannis Antetokounmpo |work=eurobasket2015.org |access-date=April 4, 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161116184811/http://www.eurobasket2015.org/en/compID_qMRZdYCZI6EoANOrUf9le2.season_2015.roundID_9322.teamID_291.playerID_99285.html |archive-date=November 16, 2016 |url-status=usurped}}</ref>

Antetokounmpo also played with Greece at the [[2016 FIBA World Olympic Qualifying Tournament – Turin|2016 Turin FIBA World Olympic Qualifying Tournament]], where he averaged 15.3 points, 5.7 rebounds, 2.0 assists, 0.7 steals, and 2.0 blocks per game in 3 games played.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://archive.fiba.com/pages/eng/fa/player/p/pid/99285/sid/12515/tid/291/_/2016_FIBA_Olympic_Qualifying_Tournament/index.html |title=Giannis Antetokounmpo profile, FIBA Olympic Qualifying Tournament 2016 |website=FIBA.COM |access-date=September 4, 2023 |archive-date=October 24, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231024060436/https://archive.fiba.com/pages/eng/fa/player/p/pid/99285/sid/12515/tid/291/_/2016_FIBA_Olympic_Qualifying_Tournament/index.html |url-status=live}}</ref> Greece failed to qualify for the [[Basketball at the 2016 Summer Olympics – Men's tournament|2016 Summer Olympics]], after being eliminated by [[Croatian men's national basketball team|Croatia]], by a score of 66–61.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://archive.fiba.com/pages/eng/fa/game/p/gid/A/grid/7/rid/12518/sid/12515/tid/291/_/2016_FIBA_Olympic_Qualifying_Tournament/statistic.html |title=archive.fiba.com: 2016 FIBA Olympic Qualifying Tournament |website=archive.fiba.com |access-date=January 10, 2017 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170110162837/http://archive.fiba.com/pages/eng/fa/game/p/gid/A/grid/7/rid/12518/sid/12515/tid/291/_/2016_FIBA_Olympic_Qualifying_Tournament/statistic.html |archive-date=January 10, 2017 |url-status=live}}</ref> He also played with Greece during their preparation phase for the [[EuroBasket 2017]]. He scored 20 points in a prep game against [[Montenegrin national basketball team|Montenegro]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://basket.gr/index.php/gameview?gameid=4444 |title=11-08-2017 / BELGRADE GREECE 83 - 81 MONTENEGRO. |access-date=September 25, 2019 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190925163141/http://basket.gr/index.php/gameview%3Fgameid%3D4444 |archive-date=September 25, 2019 |url-status=live}}</ref> However, he missed the actual EuroBasket 2017 tournament, due to a knee injury.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.cbssports.com/nba/news/giannis-antetokounmpo-to-miss-eurobasket-2017-greece-federation-blames-bucks/ |title=Giannis Antetokounmpo to miss Eurobasket 2017; Greece Federation blames Bucks. |date=August 19, 2017 |access-date=September 25, 2019 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190925163546/https://www.cbssports.com/nba/news/giannis-antetokounmpo-to-miss-eurobasket-2017-greece-federation-blames-bucks/ |archive-date=September 25, 2019 |url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.eurohoops.net/en/eurobasket/497970/giannis-antetokounmpo-miss-eurobasket/ |title=Giannis Antetokounmpo to miss EuroBasket. |date=August 19, 2017 |access-date=September 25, 2019 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190925163547/https://www.eurohoops.net/en/eurobasket/497970/giannis-antetokounmpo-miss-eurobasket/ |archive-date=September 25, 2019 |url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://bleacherreport.com/articles/2601826-giannis-antetokounmpo-ruled-out-of-eurobasket-2017-with-knee-injury |title=Giannis Antetokounmpo Ruled Out of EuroBasket 2017 with Knee Injury. |website=[[Bleacher Report]] |access-date=September 25, 2019 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190925163549/https://bleacherreport.com/articles/2601826-giannis-antetokounmpo-ruled-out-of-eurobasket-2017-with-knee-injury |archive-date=September 25, 2019 |url-status=live}}</ref>

Antetokounmpo represented Greece at the [[2019 FIBA Basketball World Cup]], where he became the first reigning [[NBA Most Valuable Player Award|NBA MVP]] to play in a World Cup.<ref name="Sports Illustrated">{{Cite news |agency=Associated Press |title=The MVP exits: Giannis, Greece fail to advance at World Cup |url=https://www.si.com/nba/2019/09/09/giannis-anteotkounmpo-greece-out-fiba-world-cup |access-date=August 27, 2022 |magazine=Sports Illustrated |language=en-us |archive-date=August 27, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220827113054/https://www.si.com/nba/2019/09/09/giannis-anteotkounmpo-greece-out-fiba-world-cup |url-status=live}}</ref> He averaged 14.8 points, 8.8 rebounds, 2.4 assists, 2.4 steals, and 0.6 blocks per game, in 5 games played.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.fiba.basketball/basketballworldcup/2019/player/Giannis-Antetokounmpo |title=Giannis ANTETOKOUNMPO 2019 FIBA Basketball World Cup STATISTICS. |access-date=September 25, 2019 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190925162533/http://www.fiba.basketball/basketballworldcup/2019/player/Giannis-Antetokounmpo |archive-date=September 25, 2019 |url-status=live}}</ref> Greece finished 11th in the tournament after they failed to advance past the second round, which was regarded as a disappointing result in national and international sports media.<ref>{{Cite web |title=New Horizons in store for Greece after World Cup disaster |url=https://www.agonasport.com/agonasport-allnews/new-horizons-in-store-for-greece-after-world-cup-disaster |access-date=August 27, 2022 |website=AGONAsport.com |language=en-US |archive-date=August 27, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220827113054/https://www.agonasport.com/agonasport-allnews/new-horizons-in-store-for-greece-after-world-cup-disaster |url-status=live}}</ref><ref name="Sports Illustrated" />

He rejoined the team in August 2022. On August 25, 2022, Antetokounmpo scored a national team career-high 40 points, along with 8 rebounds and 5 assists, in a 94–100 overtime loss to [[Serbia men's national basketball team|Serbia]] in the [[2023 FIBA Basketball World Cup qualification|2023 World Cup]] qualifiers.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Nikola Jokic pushes Serbia past Giannis Antetokounmpo and Greece in overtime |url=https://basketnews.com/news-176934-nikola-jokic-pushes-serbia-past-giannis-antetokounmpo-and-greece-in-overtime.html |access-date=August 27, 2022 |website=basketnews.com |language=en |archive-date=August 27, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220827113053/https://basketnews.com/news-176934-nikola-jokic-pushes-serbia-past-giannis-antetokounmpo-and-greece-in-overtime.html |url-status=live}}</ref>

In September, Antetokounmpo played in the [[EuroBasket 2022]] with Greece, his second of such tournament. On September 6, Antetokounmpo scored 41 points in a 99–79 group stage win over [[Ukraine men's national basketball team|Ukraine]].<ref>{{Cite web |title=Giannis goes big as Greece usurp Ukraine to cement Group C top spot |url=https://www.fiba.basketball/eurobasket/2022/news/giannis-goes-big-as-greece-usurp-ukraine-to-cement-top-spot |access-date=September 8, 2022 |website=FIBA.basketball |date=September 6, 2022 |language=en |archive-date=September 8, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220908094218/https://www.fiba.basketball/eurobasket/2022/news/giannis-goes-big-as-greece-usurp-ukraine-to-cement-top-spot |url-status=live}}</ref> This was the twelfth-highest points tally of all time, and the most points scored in a EuroBasket game since [[Dirk Nowitzki]] in [[EuroBasket 2001|2001]].<ref>{{Cite web |date=September 6, 2022 |title=Giannis makes history with 41 points, while trying to "create art" |url=https://www.eurohoops.net/en/eurobasket/1387166/giannis-antetokounmpo-makes-history-with-41-points-while-trying-to-create-art/ |access-date=September 8, 2022 |website=Eurohoops |language=en |archive-date=September 8, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220908094219/https://www.eurohoops.net/en/eurobasket/1387166/giannis-antetokounmpo-makes-history-with-41-points-while-trying-to-create-art/ |url-status=live}}</ref> Greece was eliminated by [[Germany men's national basketball team|Germany]] in the quarter-finals, in a game in which Antetokounmpo had 31 points, 7 rebounds and 8 assists but was ejected after two unsportsmanlike fouls.<ref>{{Cite web |date=September 13, 2022 |title=Germany's lights out show halts Giannis, Greece to reach Semi-Finals |url=https://www.fiba.basketball/eurobasket/2022/news/germany-s-lights-out-show-halts-giannis-greece-to-reach-semi-finals |access-date=September 14, 2022 |website=FIBA.basketball |language=en |archive-date=September 14, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220914074640/https://www.fiba.basketball/eurobasket/2022/news/germany-s-lights-out-show-halts-giannis-greece-to-reach-semi-finals |url-status=live}}</ref> He averaged 29.3 points, 8.8 rebounds, 4.7 assists, 1.5 steals and 0.8 blocks per game in 6 games played, while shooting 56.6% from the field.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Giannis ANTETOKOUNMPO at the FIBA EuroBasket 2022 |url=https://www.fiba.basketball/eurobasket/2022/player/Giannis-Antetokounmpo |access-date=September 18, 2022 |website=FIBA.basketball |language=en |archive-date=September 20, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220920172707/https://www.fiba.basketball/eurobasket/2022/player/Giannis-Antetokounmpo |url-status=live}}</ref> Antetokounmpo finished [[FIBA EuroBasket Top Scorer|the tournament as the leading scorer]] and was selected to the [[FIBA EuroBasket All-Tournament Team|All-Tournament Team]].

At the [[2024 Summer Olympics]], he carried the [[Flag of Greece|Greek flag]] at the [[Opening ceremonies at the olympic games|Opening Ceremonies]]. He subsequently represented Greece in group stage against [[Canada men's national basketball team|Canada]], Spain and [[Australia men's national basketball team|Australia]], eventually finishing third with a 1–2 record. Greece was eliminated by Germany in the quarter-finals, in a game in which Antetokounmpo scored 22 points. He averaged a tournament high 25.8 points along with 6.3 rebounds, 3.5 assists in 4 games played, while shooting 67.8% from the field.<ref>{{Cite web |date=August 8, 2024 |title=Giannis ANTETOKOUNMPO - Player Profile - 2024 Summer Olympics |url=https://www.fiba.basketball/en/events/mens-olympic-basketball-tournament-paris-2024/teams/greece/195895-giannis-antetokounmpo |access-date=August 8, 2024 |website=FIBA.basketball |language=en}}</ref> For his performances, Antetokounmpo was named to the tournament's All-Second Team.<ref>{{Cite web |date=August 10, 2024 |title=Gilgeous-Alexander, Bogdanovic, F. Wagner, Yabusele, Antetokounmpo named to Paris 2024 All-Second Team |url=https://www.fiba.basketball/en/events/mens-olympic-basketball-tournament-paris-2024/news/gilgeous-alexander-bogdanovic-f-wagner-yabusele-antetokounmpo-named-to-paris |access-date=August 22, 2024 |website=FIBA.basketball |language=en}}</ref>

From 2014 to 2024, Antetokounmpo played with the senior men's Greek national team in 37 official games, in major FIBA tournaments. In those specific games, he has scored a total of 725 points, for a scoring average of 19.6 points per game.<ref>{{Cite web |date=August 8, 2024 |title=Giannis ANTETOKOUNMPO - Player Profile - FIBA.basketball |url=https://www.fiba.basketball/en/player/195895/Giannis--Antetokounmpo |access-date=August 8, 2024 |website=FIBA.basketball |language=en}}</ref>

==Player profile==
[[File:Giannis Antetokounmpo (51916274036) (cropped).jpg|thumb|right|Antetokounmpo during the [[2022 NBA All-Star Game]]]]
Standing {{convert|6|ft|11|in|m|2}} tall and weighing {{convert|242|lbs|kg|0}}, Antetokounmpo is officially listed as a [[Forward (basketball)|forward]] and sometimes described as a [[point forward]],<ref name=Reference>{{cite web |title=Giannis Antetokounmpo Stats |url=https://www.basketball-reference.com/players/a/antetgi01.html |website=Basketball Reference |publisher=[[Sports Reference]] |access-date=August 1, 2020 |archive-date=October 15, 2013 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131015045222/http://www.basketball-reference.com/players/a/antetgi01.html |url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |title=Giannis Antetokounmpo stats, details, videos, and news. |url=https://www.nba.com/players/giannis/antetokounmpo/203507 |website=[[National Basketball Association|NBA.com]] |access-date=August 1, 2020 |archive-date=September 22, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200922221026/https://www.nba.com/players/giannis/antetokounmpo/203507 |url-status=live}}</ref><ref name=FTE1710>{{cite web |last1=Herring |first1=Chris |title=Giannis Antetokounmpo Looks Like A Freaking MVP |url=https://fivethirtyeight.com/features/giannis-antetokounmpo-looks-like-a-freaking-mvp/ |website=[[FiveThirtyEight]] |access-date=August 1, 2020 |date=October 26, 2017 |archive-date=March 22, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220322092634/https://fivethirtyeight.com/features/giannis-antetokounmpo-looks-like-a-freaking-mvp/ |url-status=live}}</ref> but has been deployed across all five [[Basketball positions|positions]]. Highly athletic and versatile, Antetokounmpo is often recognized as one of the best all-around players in the NBA, and many analysts have declared him "positionless" and as embodying the future of the league.<ref name=Atlantic1710>{{cite web |last1=Wong |first1=Alex |title=Basketball's Positionless Savior Is Ready for Primetime |url=https://www.theatlantic.com/entertainment/archive/2017/10/basketballs-positionless-savior-is-ready-for-primetime/544286/ |website=[[The Atlantic]] |access-date=August 1, 2020 |date=October 29, 2017 |archive-date=July 17, 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210717084938/https://www.theatlantic.com/entertainment/archive/2017/10/basketballs-positionless-savior-is-ready-for-primetime/544286/ |url-status=live}}</ref><ref name=NYT1711>{{cite news |last1=Stein |first1=Marc |title=The Unspeakable Greatness of Giannis Antetokounmpo |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2017/11/03/sports/basketball/giannis-milwaukee-bucks.html |website=[[The New York Times]] |access-date=August 1, 2020 |date=October 29, 2017 |archive-date=April 25, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220425150506/https://www.nytimes.com/2017/11/03/sports/basketball/giannis-milwaukee-bucks.html |url-status=live}}</ref><ref name=FTE1612>{{cite web |last1=Paine |first1=Neil |title=We've Never Seen A Player Quite Like Giannis Antetokounmpo |url=https://fivethirtyeight.com/features/weve-never-seen-a-player-quite-like-giannis-antetokounmpo/ |website=[[FiveThirtyEight]] |access-date=August 1, 2020 |date=December 2, 2016 |archive-date=June 12, 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210612035641/https://fivethirtyeight.com/features/weve-never-seen-a-player-quite-like-giannis-antetokounmpo/ |url-status=live}}</ref>

===Offense===
By the [[2016–17 NBA season|2016–17 season]], Antetokounmpo had established himself as one of the league's most devastating [[Slasher (basketball)|slashers]] and transition scorers.<ref name=FTE1612/><ref>{{cite web |last1=Boeder |first1=Alex |title=A Couple of Ways Giannis Can Become Even Better |url=https://www.nba.com/bucks/features/boeder-couple-ways-giannis-can-become-even-better |website=[[National Basketball Association|NBA.com]] |access-date=August 1, 2020 |date=March 3, 2017 |archive-date=June 12, 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210612035637/https://www.nba.com/bucks/features/boeder-couple-ways-giannis-can-become-even-better |url-status=live}}</ref> His rare combination of size and speed frequently enables him to cross half a court in a single dribble and blowing past multiple defenders.<ref name=Atlantic1710/><ref name=NYT1711/><ref name=SBNation>{{cite web |last1=Cato |first1=Tim |title=Every time Giannis Antetokounmpo has gone from half court to the rim in 1 dribble |url=https://www.sbnation.com/nba/2017/12/18/16791482/giannis-antetokounmpo-half-court-rim-one-dribble-bucks-incredible |website=[[SB Nation]] |access-date=August 1, 2020 |date=December 18, 2017 |archive-date=April 15, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220415071346/https://www.sbnation.com/nba/2017/12/18/16791482/giannis-antetokounmpo-half-court-rim-one-dribble-bucks-incredible |url-status=live}}</ref> A 2017 analysis conducted by [[SportVU|Stats SportVU]] at the behest of [[FiveThirtyEight]] showed that Antetokounmpo was able to cover slightly more than 15 feet off a single dribble when driving to the basket, 5 feet further than the average player in the league.<ref name=FTE1710/> In addition, Antetokounmpo has developed his own version of the [[Euro step]], described by Jordan Brenner of [[ESPN.com]] as "the final phase of the move's evolution", which allows him to directly attack the rim from the three-point arc in a move that "renders the area between the top of the key and the basket all but undefendable".<ref>{{cite web |last1=Brenner |first1=Jordan |title=Why the Eurostep is the NBA's most controversial move -- and its most lethal |url=https://www.espn.com/nba/story/_/id/25206602/most-dangerous-two-step-game |website=[[ESPN.com]] |access-date=August 1, 2020 |date=November 8, 2018 |archive-date=April 8, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220408115128/https://www.espn.com/nba/story/_/id/25206602/most-dangerous-two-step-game |url-status=live}}</ref>

However, Antetokounmpo has been criticized for his lack of a reliable jump shot, having shot above 31% from three-point range just once in his career. Antetokounmpo's jumper has been exploited by other teams. Most famously, the Toronto Raptors built a 'wall' of lengthy, adept defenders to neutralise Antetokounmpo's paint dominance in their 2019 Conference Finals victory.<ref>{{cite web |title=How Kawhi Leonard and the Raptors have shut down Giannis Antetokounmpo to take control of the conference finals |url=https://www.cbssports.com/nba/news/how-kawhi-leonard-and-the-raptors-have-shut-down-giannis-antetokounmpo-to-take-control-of-the-conference-finals/ |access-date=October 16, 2020 |website=CBSSports.com |date=May 25, 2019 |language=en |archive-date=June 13, 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210613080732/https://www.cbssports.com/nba/news/how-kawhi-leonard-and-the-raptors-have-shut-down-giannis-antetokounmpo-to-take-control-of-the-conference-finals/ |url-status=live}}</ref> As a result, Antetokounmpo increased his jump-shooting output, averaging a career-high 4.4 three-point goals attempted and 1.4 made per game in 2019–20.<ref name=Reference/>

Antetokounmpo has also received attention for his playmaking skills. Despite not being the primary ball handler of the Bucks, he has largely orchestrated the team's offense. During the 2019–20 season, Antetokounmpo was responsible (through assisting and personally scoring) for 57.8% of the points the Bucks scored while he was on the floor, one of the highest rates in the league.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Dubin |first1=Jared |title=Giannis Antetokounmpo Is Creating More Than Ever |url=https://fivethirtyeight.com/features/giannis-antetokounmpo-is-creating-more-than-ever/ |website=[[FiveThirtyEight]] |access-date=August 1, 2020 |date=January 7, 2020 |archive-date=December 31, 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20211231190151/https://fivethirtyeight.com/features/giannis-antetokounmpo-is-creating-more-than-ever/ |url-status=live}}</ref> He averaged nearly 6 assists per game during both the 2018–19 and 2019–20 seasons.<ref name=Reference/>

===Defense===
Antetokounmpo is also recognized as an elite defensive player, capable of guarding all five positions but more often deployed in a "[[Safety (gridiron football position)|free safety]]" role that allows him to roam the paint and discourage attacks on the rim.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Sampson |first1=Brian |title=Bucks' Giannis Antetokounmpo Has NBA's Best Case For Defensive Player Of The Year |url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/briansampson/2020/05/20/bucks-giannis-antetokounmpo-has-best-case-for-defensive-player-of-the-year/#5d394d7c468b |website=[[Forbes]] |access-date=August 1, 2020 |date=May 20, 2020 |archive-date=June 16, 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210616061626/https://www.forbes.com/sites/briansampson/2020/05/20/bucks-giannis-antetokounmpo-has-best-case-for-defensive-player-of-the-year/#5d394d7c468b |url-status=live}}</ref> He is also a proficient shot-blocker and has developed a reputation for blocking opponents in transition (the chase-down block).<ref>{{cite web |last1=Devine |first1=Dan |title=If the NBA Season Is Over, Who Deserves Defensive Player of the Year? |url=https://www.theringer.com/nba/2020/3/25/21193466/giannis-antetokounmpo-anthony-davis-nba-defensive-player-year |website=[[The Ringer (website)|The Ringer]] |access-date=August 1, 2020 |date=March 25, 2020 |archive-date=April 19, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220419140308/https://www.theringer.com/nba/2020/3/25/21193466/giannis-antetokounmpo-anthony-davis-nba-defensive-player-year |url-status=live}}</ref>
With Antetokounmpo in this role, the Bucks have flourished into one of the league's best defensive teams, leading the NBA in defensive rating in 2018–19 and 2019–20.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.actionnetwork.com/nba/milwaukee-bucks-defense-betting-2019 |title=Mears: How the Milwaukee Bucks Built the NBA's Best Defense | The Action Network |date=February 21, 2019 |website=Action Network |access-date=August 2, 2020 |archive-date=February 27, 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210227124813/https://www.actionnetwork.com/nba/milwaukee-bucks-defense-betting-2019 |url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://fivethirtyeight.com/features/few-teams-have-ever-defended-like-these-milwaukee-bucks/ |title=Few Teams Have Ever Defended Like These Milwaukee Bucks |first=Chris |last=Herring |date=February 27, 2020 |access-date=August 2, 2020 |archive-date=April 4, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220404202424/https://fivethirtyeight.com/features/few-teams-have-ever-defended-like-these-milwaukee-bucks/ |url-status=live}}</ref> For his defensive efforts, Antetokounmpo won the 2020 NBA Defensive Player of the Year, and he has become a perennial [[NBA All-Defensive Team|NBA All-Defensive]] honoree.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://bleacherreport.com/articles/2901676-bucks-giannis-antetokounmpo-named-2019-20-nba-defensive-player-of-the-year#:~:text=Milwaukee%20Bucks-,Bucks'%20Giannis%20Antetokounmpo%20Named%202019%2D20%20NBA,Defensive%20Player%20of%20the%20Year&text=superstar%20Giannis%20Antetokounmpo%20was%20named,in%20his%20seven%2Dyear%20career |title=Bucks' Giannis Antetokounmpo Named 2019-20 NBA Defensive Player of the Year |publisher=Bleacher Report |date=August 25, 2020 |access-date=August 25, 2020 |archive-date=September 21, 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210921222556/https://bleacherreport.com/articles/2901676-bucks-giannis-antetokounmpo-named-2019-20-nba-defensive-player-of-the-year#:~:text=Milwaukee%20Bucks-,Bucks'%20Giannis%20Antetokounmpo%20Named%202019%2D20%20NBA,Defensive%20Player%20of%20the%20Year&text=superstar%20Giannis%20Antetokounmpo%20was%20named,in%20his%20seven%2Dyear%20career |url-status=live}}</ref>

==Records==
*Only player in NBA history to finish a regular season in the top 20 in all five statistics of total points, rebounds, assists, steals and blocks.<ref>{{cite web |last=Cato |first=Tim |url=https://www.sbnation.com/nba/2017/4/10/15249756/giannis-antetokounmpo-stats-bucks-top-20-first |title=Giannis Antetokounmpo became the 1st player to finish in the top-20 in all major stats |work=SBNation.com |date=April 12, 2017 |access-date=April 12, 2017 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170413153919/http://www.sbnation.com/nba/2017/4/10/15249756/giannis-antetokounmpo-stats-bucks-top-20-first |archive-date=April 13, 2017 |url-status=live}}</ref>
*Only player in NBA history to average at least 25 points, 10 rebounds, 5 assists, 1 steals and 1 blocks in multiple seasons.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.nba.com/news/fantasy-basketball-12-team-1st-round-mock-draft-2022-23 |title=FANTASY BASKETBALL: 12-TEAM, 1ST-ROUND MOCK DRAFT FOR 2022-23 |website=NBA.com |date=September 23, 2022 |access-date=September 24, 2022 |archive-date=September 23, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220923221035/https://www.nba.com/news/fantasy-basketball-12-team-1st-round-mock-draft-2022-23 |url-status=live}}</ref>
*Only player in NBA history to average at least 30 points and 60 percent field goal percentage in a season.
*Only non-American player in NBA history to win the All-Star Game MVP.
*Only player in NBA history to have 200 points, 100 rebounds and 50 assists in a playoff series.
*Only player in NBA history to average at least 31 points, 14 rebounds and 6 assists in a single postseason.
*Highest scoring close-out Finals game in NBA history (50 points): Milwaukee Bucks, {{nbay|2020}}
**Tied with [[Bob Petit]] (St. Louis Hawks, {{nbay|1957}})
*Second NBA player to average at least 30 points, 10 rebounds, 5 assists on 55% field goal percentage in a single season: Milwaukee Bucks, {{nbay|2022}}
**Also achieved by [[Kareem Abdul-Jabbar]] (Milwaukee Bucks, {{nbay|1972}})
*Third NBA player to win MVP and Defensive Player of the Year awards in the same season: Milwaukee Bucks, {{nbay|2019}}
**Also achieved by [[Michael Jordan]] (Chicago Bulls, {{nbay|1987}}), and [[Hakeem Olajuwon]] (Houston Rockets, {{nbay|1993}})
*Third NBA player to post a 40 points, 20 rebounds and 5 assists game in the playoffs: Milwaukee Bucks, {{nbay|2021}}
**Also achieved by [[Wilt Chamberlain]] (Philadelphia Warriors, {{nbay|1961}}) and (Philadelphia 76ers, {{nbay|1966}}), and [[Shaquille O'Neal]] (Los Angeles Lakers, {{nbay|2000}})
*Fourth NBA player since the NBA-ABA merger to post 30 points, 20 rebounds and 10 assists in a game: Milwaukee Bucks, {{nbay|2022}}
**Also achieved by [[David Lee (basketball)|David Lee]] (New York Knicks, {{nbay|2009}}), [[DeMarcus Cousins]] (New Orleans Pelicans, {{nbay|2017}}), and [[Nikola Jokić]] (Denver Nuggets, {{nbay|2019}} and {{nbay|2022}})
*Fifth NBA player to lead his team in all five major statistics (points, rebounds, assists, steals, blocks) in the same season: Milwaukee Bucks, {{nbay|2016}}<ref>{{cite news |url=https://bleacherreport.com/articles/2703493-giannis-antetokounmpo-is-fifth-player-to-lead-team-in-pts-reb-ast-stl-blks |title=Giannis Antetokounmpo Is 5th Player to Lead Team in Pts, Reb, Ast, Stl & Blks |publisher=Bleacher Report |date=April 13, 2017 |access-date=September 24, 2022 |archive-date=September 24, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220924020127/https://bleacherreport.com/articles/2703493-giannis-antetokounmpo-is-fifth-player-to-lead-team-in-pts-reb-ast-stl-blks |url-status=live}}</ref>
**Also achieved by [[Dave Cowens]] (Boston Celtics, {{nbay|1977}}), [[Scottie Pippen]] (Chicago Bulls, {{nbay|1994}}), [[Kevin Garnett]] (Minnesota Timberwolves, 2002–03) [[LeBron James]] (Cleveland Cavaliers, {{nbay|2008}}), and [[Nikola Jokić]] (Denver Nuggets, {{nbay|2021}})

== Outside of basketball ==
In August 2022, Calamos Advisors announced that they would work with Antetokounmpo on an [[exchange-traded fund]] that invests in sustainable firms that would be called the Calamos Antetokounmpo Sustainable Equities Fund.<ref>{{Cite news |date=August 29, 2022 |title=NBA Star Giannis Antetokounmpo Is Lending His Name to an ETF |language=en |work=Bloomberg.com |url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2022-08-29/nba-investor-greek-freak-giannis-antetokounmpo-lends-name-to-new-etf |access-date=September 7, 2022}}</ref>

In September 2022, Antetokounmpo joined as an executive producer for [[National Geographic]]'s documentary ''[[The Flagmakers]]'', which focuses on the large population of immigrant employees working at an American flag factory. Antetokounmpo called the project inspiring, saying: "As an immigrant myself, I find this film incredibly personal and a deeply moving testament to those who call this country 'home'".<ref name="deadline">{{cite web |url=https://deadline.com/video/the-flagmakers-trailer-premiere-national-geographic-documentary-directors-cynthia-wade-sharon-liese-ep-giannis-antetokounmpo-news/ |title=National Geographic Launches 'The Flagmakers', Stirring Doc On Diverse Workers At American Flag Factory, With NBA Star Giannis Antetokounmpo As EP |website=[[Deadline Hollywood|Deadline]] |last=Carey |first=Matthew |date=September 16, 2022 |access-date=February 26, 2023 |archive-date=February 26, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230226223505/https://deadline.com/video/the-flagmakers-trailer-premiere-national-geographic-documentary-directors-cynthia-wade-sharon-liese-ep-giannis-antetokounmpo-news/ |url-status=live}}</ref>

==Personal life==
[[File:Thanasis and Giannis Antetokounmpo at Sepolia, Greece.jpg|left|thumb|upright|Giannis and [[Thanasis Antetokounmpo]] playing basketball at a local court in [[Sepolia]], Athens, in 2015]]
Antetokounmpo's father, Charles, was a Nigerian [[association football|football]] player, while his mother, Veronica, is a former [[high jumper]].<ref name="npr"/> Charles died in September 2017, at age 54.<ref name="careerhigh" /> Veronica gave each of her five sons both Greek and Nigerian names, choosing the Nigerian ''Ugo'' for Giannis.<ref>{{cite web |last=Chouinard |first=KL |url=http://www.bucksketball.com/2014/01/giannis-antetokounmpos-other-name/ |title=Giannis Antetokounmpo's other name |work=Bucksketball.com |date=January 2, 2014 |access-date=April 9, 2016 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140105044338/http://www.bucksketball.com/2014/01/giannis-antetokounmpos-other-name/ |archive-date=January 5, 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://greekcitytimes.com/2018/12/06/xronia-polla-to-giannis-antetokounmpo-who-turns-24-today/ |title=Xronia polla to Giannis Antetokounmpo, who turns 24 today |work=greekcitytimes.com |date=December 6, 2018 |access-date=April 13, 2019 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190413094407/https://greekcitytimes.com/2018/12/06/xronia-polla-to-giannis-antetokounmpo-who-turns-24-today/ |archive-date=April 13, 2019 |url-status=live}}</ref> His parents are from different Nigerian ethnic groups—Charles was [[Yoruba people|Yoruba]], while Veronica is [[Igbo people|Igbo]]. According to basketball great [[Hakeem Olajuwon]], also Yoruba, the original family name of [[Adetokunbo|Adétòkunbọ̀]] translates to "the crown has returned from overseas".<ref name="Spears2019">{{cite web |url=https://andscape.com/features/bucks-giannis-antetokounmpo-greek-freak-wants-to-go-back-to-his-nigerian-roots/ |title='The Greek Freak' wants to go back to his Nigerian roots |first=Marc J. |last=Spears |publisher=[[Andscape]] |date=March 5, 2019 |access-date=March 8, 2019 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190308205554/https://theundefeated.com/features/bucks-giannis-antetokounmpo-greek-freak-wants-to-go-back-to-his-nigerian-roots/ |archive-date=March 8, 2019 |url-status=live}}</ref> Giannis wears the number 34 in honor of his parents, who were born in 1963 and 1964.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.essentiallysports.com/nba-news-why-does-giannis-antetokoumpo-wear-34-for-the-milwaukee-bucks/ |title=Why Does Giannis Antetokoumpo Wear 34 for the Milwaukee Bucks? |date=July 15, 2021 |access-date=July 22, 2021 |archive-date=October 24, 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20211024112225/https://www.essentiallysports.com/nba-news-why-does-giannis-antetokoumpo-wear-34-for-the-milwaukee-bucks/ |url-status=live}}</ref>

Antetokounmpo has two older brothers, Francis (Greek name Andreas) and [[Thanasis Antetokounmpo|Thanasis]], as well as two younger brothers, [[Kostas Antetokounmpo|Kostas]] and [[Alex Antetokounmpo|Alex]].<ref>{{cite web |last=Helin |first=Kurt |url=http://nba.nbcsports.com/2013/10/23/greece-wanted-nothing-to-do-with-his-family-until-nba-noticed-antetokounmpos-basketball-skills/ |title=Greece wanted nothing to do with his family until NBA noticed Antetokounmpo's basketball skills |work=NBCSports.com |date=October 23, 2013 |access-date=April 4, 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160323231518/http://nba.nbcsports.com/2013/10/23/greece-wanted-nothing-to-do-with-his-family-until-nba-noticed-antetokounmpos-basketball-skills/ |archive-date=March 23, 2016 |url-status=live}}</ref> Antetokounmpo is a [[Christians|Christian]] and was raised in the [[Greek Orthodox Church]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://greece.greekreporter.com/2019/07/23/how-a-greek-orthodox-priest-made-giannis-antetokounmpo-a-devout-christian/amp/ |title=How a Greek Orthodox Priest Made Giannis Antetokounmpo a Devout Christian |date=June 2013 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20191211111411/https://greece.greekreporter.com/2019/07/23/how-a-greek-orthodox-priest-made-giannis-antetokounmpo-a-devout-christian/amp/ |archive-date=December 11, 2019}}</ref> He was baptized in the Greek Orthodox Church along with his brother Alex on October 28, 2012.<ref>"[https://neoskosmos.com/en/142028/giannis-antetokounmpos-parish-priest-reveals-basketballers-close-ties-with-greek-orthodox-church/ Giannis Antetokounmpo's parish priest reveals basketballer's close ties with Greek Orthodox church] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190724122224/https://neoskosmos.com/en/142028/giannis-antetokounmpos-parish-priest-reveals-basketballers-close-ties-with-greek-orthodox-church/ |date=July 24, 2019 }}." ''Neos Kosmos.'' 24 July 2019 2:25pm. Retrieved July 24, 2019.</ref>

Following their son and brother, the entire Antetokounmpo family, except for Francis and Thanasis, moved from Athens to [[Milwaukee]] in early 2014.<ref>{{cite web |last=Gruman |first=Andrew |url=http://www.foxsports.com/wisconsin/story/family-matters-bucks-rookie-antetokounmpo-reunited-with-family-020314 |title=Family matters: Bucks rookie Antetokounmpo reunited with family |work=FoxSports.com |date=February 3, 2014 |access-date=December 31, 2015 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150924125554/http://www.foxsports.com/wisconsin/story/family-matters-bucks-rookie-antetokounmpo-reunited-with-family-020314 |archive-date=September 24, 2015 |url-status=live}}</ref> In July 2016, Giannis and Thanasis began their [[Conscription in Greece|mandatory military service in Greece]]. The two brothers served a reduced three-month military service, as prescribed for Greek citizens who are permanent overseas residents.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.naftemporiki.gr/story/1127234/antetokounmpo-brothers-to-begin-3-month-military-service |title=Antetokounmpo brothers to begin 3-month military service |work=naftemporiki |date=July 12, 2016 |access-date=July 12, 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160713162503/http://www.naftemporiki.gr/story/1127234/antetokounmpo-brothers-to-begin-3-month-military-service |archive-date=July 13, 2016 |url-status=live}}</ref>

Thanasis made his NBA debut with the [[New York Knicks]] after being drafted by the organization with the 51st overall pick in the [[2014 NBA draft]].<ref>{{cite web |last=Steinberg |first=Russell |url=https://www.sbnation.com/nba/2014/6/26/5848318/thanasis-antetokounmpo-new-york-knicks-nba-draft-results-2014 |title=2014 NBA Draft Results: Knicks select Thanasis Antetokounmpo with 51st pick |work=SBNation.com |date=June 27, 2014 |access-date=December 31, 2015 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160303220042/http://www.sbnation.com/nba/2014/6/26/5848318/thanasis-antetokounmpo-new-york-knicks-nba-draft-results-2014 |archive-date=March 3, 2016 |url-status=live}}</ref> After playing for [[BC Andorra|Andorra]] during the 2016–17 season and the [[Greece|Greek]] [[EuroLeague]] powerhouse [[Panathinaikos B.C.|Panathinaikos]] for the next two seasons, he signed with the [[Milwaukee Bucks]] on July 16, 2019.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.nba.com/bucks/news/bucks-sign-thanasis-antetokounmpo |title=Bucks Sign Thanasis Antetokounmpo |website=Milwaukee Bucks |language=en |access-date=July 30, 2019 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190718141452/https://www.nba.com/bucks/news/bucks-sign-thanasis-antetokounmpo |archive-date=July 18, 2019 |url-status=live}}</ref> Antetokounmpo's younger brother, Kostas, played [[college basketball]] for [[Dayton Flyers men's basketball|Dayton]] before being selected with the last pick in the [[2018 NBA draft]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.midmajormadness.com/2016/10/3/13148932/dayton-flyers-kostas-antetokounmpo-ineligible-redshirt-ncaa |title=Dayton's Kostas Antetokounmpo ruled ineligible for 2016-17 |last=Mitchell |first=Greg |date=October 3, 2016 |website=Mid-Major Madness |access-date=April 23, 2019 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190423200622/https://www.midmajormadness.com/2016/10/3/13148932/dayton-flyers-kostas-antetokounmpo-ineligible-redshirt-ncaa |archive-date=April 23, 2019 |url-status=live}}</ref> He went on to win the [[2020 NBA Finals|2020 NBA Championship]] with the [[Los Angeles Lakers]]. In 2021, Kostas signed with [[ASVEL Basket]], part of the French [[LNB Pro A|Betclic Élite]] and the [[EuroLeague]].<ref>{{cite news |first=Alessandro |last=Maggi |title=Kostas Antetokounmpo signs with Asvel |url=https://sportando.basketball/en/kostas-antetokounmpo-signs-with-asvel/ |newspaper=Sportando |date=July 16, 2021 |access-date=July 23, 2021 |archive-date=January 20, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220120123143/https://sportando.basketball/en/kostas-antetokounmpo-signs-with-asvel/ |url-status=live}}</ref> He currently plays for Panathinaikos in Greece. Their youngest brother, Alex, played high school basketball in the US before becoming a professional basketball player.
[[File:Antetokounmpo Brothers (cropped).jpg|thumb|right|The Antetokounmpo brothers participating in the [[2022 NBA All-Star Game#Skills Challenge|2022 NBA All-Star Skills Challenge]]]]
In the mid-2010's, Antetokounmpo began dating [[Mariah Riddlesprigger]], a native of [[Fresno, California]].<ref>{{cite web |last1=Dye |first1=Natasha |title=Giannis Antetokounmpo's Fiancée Mariah on Finding Her 'Own Identity' by 'Giving Back' to Milwaukee (Exclusive) |url=https://people.com/giannis-antetokounmpo-fiancee-mariah-finds-passion-in-community-outreach-exclusive-8411566 |website=People |access-date=February 19, 2024 |date=December 18, 2023}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |last1=Thompson |first1=Eliza |title=NBA Player Giannis Antetokounmpo and Mariah Riddlesprigger's Relationship Timeline |url=https://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/pictures/giannis-antetokounmpo-mariah-riddlespriggers-romance-timeline/ |website=[[Us Weekly]] |access-date=September 1, 2024 |date=September 18, 2023}}</ref> In February 2020, Riddlesprigger gave birth to their first son, Liam.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://eu.usatoday.com/story/sports/nba/bucks/2020/02/10/giannis-antetokoumpo-girlfriend-welcome-baby-boy/4719616002/ |title=Giannis is a dad! Bucks star and girlfriend Mariah Riddlesprigger welcome Liam Charles Antetokounmpo |work=USA Today |publisher=Gannett |access-date=February 17, 2020 |archive-date=July 16, 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210716233728/https://www.usatoday.com/story/sports/nba/bucks/2020/02/10/giannis-antetokoumpo-girlfriend-welcome-baby-boy/4719616002/ |url-status=live}}</ref> She gave birth to a second son, Maverick, in August 2021,<ref>{{cite web |title=Our healthy baby boy, Maverick Shai Antetokounmpo, was born on August 18, 2021 |url=https://www.instagram.com/p/CWGQ3w5pwpv/ |website=Instagram |publisher=sincerelyymariah |access-date=March 30, 2022 |archive-date=March 30, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220330120123/https://www.instagram.com/accounts/login/?next=/p/CWGQ3w5pwpv/ |url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |last1=Kissel |first1=Thomas |title=Giannis Antetokounmpo Announces the Name of His Second Son |url=https://greekreporter.com/2021/11/12/giannis-antetokounmpo-son/ |website=Greek Reporter |date=November 12, 2021 |access-date=March 30, 2022 |archive-date=November 17, 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20211117184952/https://greekreporter.com/2021/11/12/giannis-antetokounmpo-son/ |url-status=live}}</ref> and a daughter, Eva, in September 2023.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Latimer |first1=Jolene |title=Giannis Antetokounmpo's 3 Kids: All About Liam, Maverick and Eva |url=https://people.com/parents/all-about-giannis-antetokounmpo-kids/#:~:text=The%20Milwaukee%20Bucks%20forward%2C%20who,their%20newborn%20daughter%20Eva%20Brooke. |website=people |access-date=December 25, 2023 |archive-date=December 25, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231225063751/https://people.com/parents/all-about-giannis-antetokounmpo-kids/#:~:text=The%20Milwaukee%20Bucks%20forward%2C%20who,their%20newborn%20daughter%20Eva%20Brooke. |url-status=live}}</ref> Antetokounmpo and Riddlesprigger got married in a private ceremony on September 1, 2024, at the Costa Navarino resort near [[Pylos]].<ref>{{cite web |date=September 1, 2024 |title=Giannis Antetokounmpo and Mariah Riddlesprigger tied the knot with Khris Middleton being the best man |url=https://www.eurohoops.net/en/nba-news/1711542/giannis-antetokounmpo-and-mariah-riddlesprigger-tied-the-knot-with-khris-middleton-being-the-best-man/ |access-date=September 1, 2024 |website=Eurohoops.net}}</ref> Milwaukee Bucks teammate [[Khris Middleton]] served as the best man. 

On March 13, 2020, Antetokounmpo and his family pledged to give $100,000 to the staff of the [[Fiserv Forum]] who were unable to work during the [[suspension of the 2019–20 NBA season]] because of the [[COVID-19 pandemic]].<ref>{{cite web |title=Giannis Antetokounmpo, Zion Williamson among stars aiding arena workers |date=March 13, 2020 |url=https://www.espn.com/nba/story/_/id/28898869/giannis-antetokounmpo-pledges-100k-help-fiserv-forum-staff |access-date=March 14, 2020 |archive-date=April 8, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220408181227/https://www.espn.com/nba/story/_/id/28898869/giannis-antetokounmpo-pledges-100k-help-fiserv-forum-staff |url-status=live}}</ref> Antetokounmpo and his family also donated 20,000 masks to people in Athens and [[Zografou]] in Greece in 2020.<ref>{{cite web |date=April 8, 2020 |title=Antetokounmpo family donates 20,000 masks to Athens and Zografou |url=https://www.eurohoops.net/en/nba-news/1048451/antetokounmpo-family-donates-20000-masks-to-municipality-of-their-first-team/ |access-date=June 20, 2021 |website=Eurohoops.net |archive-date=June 27, 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210627191903/https://www.eurohoops.net/en/nba-news/1048451/antetokounmpo-family-donates-20000-masks-to-municipality-of-their-first-team/ |url-status=live}}</ref>

On August 20, 2021, Antetokounmpo became a minority owner of the [[Milwaukee Brewers]] of [[Major League Baseball]].<ref>{{Cite web |last=Passan |first=Jeff |date=August 20, 2021 |title=Milwaukee Bucks' Giannis Antetokounmpo purchases stake in Milwaukee Brewers |url=https://www.espn.com/mlb/story/_/id/32056841/milwaukee-bucks-giannis-antetokounmpo-purchase-stake-milwaukee-brewers-sources-say/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220414210803/https://www.espn.com/mlb/story/_/id/32056841/milwaukee-bucks-giannis-antetokounmpo-purchase-stake-milwaukee-brewers-sources-say/ |archive-date=April 14, 2022 |access-date=August 21, 2021 |website=ESPN.com. |agency=Associated Press}}</ref> Antetokounmpo also holds a passion for soccer, being a supporter of Italian football club [[Inter Milan]].<ref>{{cite web |title=INTER VLOG - A jump and we're in the USA, CHICAGO - MILWAUKEE |website=[[YouTube]] |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xVpbV8ppCuI |date=December 13, 2022 |access-date=December 14, 2022 |archive-date=December 14, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20221214111753/https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xVpbV8ppCuI |url-status=live}}</ref> In March 2023, Giannis, along with his brothers, Alex, Thanasis, and Kostas, became minority owners in the Major League Soccer club [[Nashville SC]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.nashvillesc.com/news/filip-forsberg-giannis-antetokounmpo-join-nashville-soccer-club-ownership-group |title=Filip Forsberg, Giannis Antetokounmpo Join Nashville Soccer Club Ownership Group |website=nashvillesc.com. |date=March 2, 2023 |access-date=March 2, 2023 |archive-date=March 2, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230302192703/https://www.nashvillesc.com/news/filip-forsberg-giannis-antetokounmpo-join-nashville-soccer-club-ownership-group |url-status=live}}</ref>

In June 2023, Giannis and his brothers [[Thanasis Antetokounmpo|Thanasis]], [[Kostas Antetokounmpo|Kostas]] and [[Alex Antetokounmpo|Alex]] expanded their investment portfolio, overseen by Ante Inc., by becoming shareholders and owners of the Canadian online confectionary retailer, Candy Funhouse.<ref>{{Cite web |date=June 6, 2023 |title=NBA All-Star Giannis Antetokounmpo Becomes Stakeholder of Canadian Confectionary Brand, Candy Funhouse |url=https://finance.yahoo.com/news/nba-star-giannis-antetokounmpo-becomes-113300667.html |access-date=May 10, 2024 |website=Yahoo Finance |language=en-US}}</ref>

In September 2023, Giannis signed on as an Executive Producer of a reality TV show created by Candy Funhouse and the producers of ''[[Big Brother (American TV series)|Big Brother]]'', Fly on the Wall.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Rice |first=Lynette |date=September 6, 2023 |title=Fly On The Wall Partners With Giannis Antetokounmpo's Candy Funhouse On Competition Series |url=https://deadline.com/2023/09/fly-on-the-wall-entertainment-candy-funhouse-for-unscripted-competition-series-1235537632/ |access-date=May 10, 2024 |website=Deadline |language=en-US}}</ref>
